title.en: Biographies of the disciples of Zhongni
title.raw: 《仲尼弟子列傳》 Biographies of the disciples of Zhongni

sentences.zh: 孔子曰「受業身通者七十有七人」，皆異能之士也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Those who received teachings and were personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all men of exceptional abilities.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Those who received my teachings and became personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all exceptional men.

sentences.zh: 德行：顏淵，閔子騫，冉伯牛，仲弓。

translations.literal: Moral conduct: Yan Yuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Virtue: Yanyuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhonggong.

translations.literal: Governance: Ran You, Ji Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Government: Ranyou, Jilu.

translations.literal: Eloquence: Zai Wo, Zi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Speech: Zaiwo, Zigong.

translations.literal: Scholarship: Zi You, Zi Xia.
translations.idiomatic: Literature: Ziyou, Zixia.

sentences.zh: 師也辟，參也魯，柴也愚，由也喭，回也屢空。

translations.literal: Shi is dissolute, Shen is dull, Chai is foolish, You is crude, Hui is often empty.
translations.idiomatic: Shi was dissolute, Shen dull, Chai foolish, You crude, Hui often empty.

sentences.zh: 賜不受命而貨殖焉，億則屢中。

translations.literal: Ci did not accept office but engaged in commerce, his speculations often hit the mark.
translations.idiomatic: Ci refused office to engage in trade, where his speculations often proved accurate.

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Those who received teachings and were personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all men of exceptional abilities. Moral conduct: Yan Yuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhong Gong. Governance: Ran You, Ji Lu. Eloquence: Zai Wo, Zi Gong. Scholarship: Zi You, Zi Xia. Shi is dissolute, Shen is dull, Chai is foolish, You is crude, Hui is often empty. Ci did not accept office but engaged in commerce, his speculations often hit the mark.

sentences.zh: 孔子之所嚴事：於周則老子；

translations.literal: Those whom Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Zi;
translations.idiomatic: Those Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Tzu;

translations.literal: in Wei, Qu Bo Yu;
translations.idiomatic: in Wey, Qu Boyu;

translations.literal: in Qi, Yan Ping Zhong;
translations.idiomatic: in Ch'i, Yan Tzu;

translations.literal: in Chu, Lao Lai Zi;
translations.idiomatic: in Chu, Lao Laizi;

translations.literal: in Zheng, Zi Chan;
translations.idiomatic: in Zheng, Zichan;

translations.literal: in Lu, Meng Gong Chuo.
translations.idiomatic: in Lu, Meng Gongchuo.

sentences.zh: 數稱臧文仲、柳下惠、銅鞮伯華、介山子然，孔子皆後之，不并世。

translations.literal: He frequently praised Zang Wen Zhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bo Hua, Jie Shan Zi Ran, Confucius all came after them, not contemporaries.
translations.idiomatic: He frequently praised Zang Wenzhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bohua, Jie Shan Ziran. Confucius all came after them and was not their contemporary.

translations.literal: Those whom Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Zi; in Wei, Qu Bo Yu; in Qi, Yan Ping Zhong; in Chu, Lao Lai Zi; in Zheng, Zi Chan; in Lu, Meng Gong Chuo. He frequently praised Zang Wen Zhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bo Hua, Jie Shan Zi Ran, Confucius all came after them, not contemporaries.
Yan Hui was a Lu man, styled Zi Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Hui was a man from Lu, styled Ziyuan.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Yan Hui was a Lu man, styled Zi Yuan. Younger than Confucius by thirty years.

sentences.zh: 顏淵問仁，孔子曰：「克己復禮，天下歸仁焉。」

translations.literal: Yan Yuan asked about benevolence, Confucius said: 'Conquer self and return to ritual, all under Heaven will return to benevolence.'
translations.idiomatic: Yanyuan asked about benevolence. Confucius said: 'Conquer the self and return to ritual. Then all under Heaven will achieve benevolence.'

translations.literal: Yan Yuan asked about benevolence, Confucius said: 'Conquer self and return to ritual, all under Heaven will return to benevolence.'
Confucius said: 'Worthy indeed is Hui!
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'How worthy Hui is!

sentences.zh: 一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷，人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。」

translations.literal: One basket of food, one gourd of drink, in a humble lane, others cannot bear his worries, Hui does not change his joy.'
translations.idiomatic: A single basket of food, a single gourd of drink, dwelling in a humble lane—others cannot bear such hardship, yet Hui does not change his joy.''

translations.literal: 'Hui appears foolish;
translations.idiomatic: 'Hui seems foolish on the surface,

sentences.zh: 退而省其私，亦足以發，回也不愚。」

translations.literal: when he withdraws and examines his private thoughts, it is sufficient to inspire, Hui is not foolish.'
translations.idiomatic: but when he withdraws to reflect on his inner thoughts, it is more than enough to inspire others. Hui is not foolish.''

sentences.zh: 「用之則行，捨之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」

translations.literal: 'When employed then act, when discarded then hide, only I and you have this!'
translations.idiomatic: 'When called upon, he acts; when set aside, he withdraws. Only I and you possess this quality!'

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Worthy indeed is Hui! One basket of food, one gourd of drink, in a humble lane, others cannot bear his worries, Hui does not change his joy.' 'Hui appears foolish; when he withdraws and examines his private thoughts, it is sufficient to inspire, Hui is not foolish.' 'When employed then act, when discarded then hide, only I and you have this!'

sentences.zh: 回年二十九，發盡白，蚤死。

translations.literal: Hui at age twenty-nine, hair all white, died young.
translations.idiomatic: Hui died at age twenty-nine, his hair completely white from overwork.

sentences.zh: 孔子哭之慟，曰：「自吾有回，門人益親。」

translations.literal: Confucius wept for him in great sorrow, said: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have become more intimate.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius wept for him with great sorrow, saying: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have drawn closer to me.'

translations.literal: Hui at age twenty-nine, hair all white, died young. Confucius wept for him in great sorrow, said: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have become more intimate.'

sentences.zh: 魯哀公問：「弟子孰為好學？」

translations.literal: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which disciple is diligent in study?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which of your disciples is the most diligent in learning?'

sentences.zh: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。

translations.literal: Confucius replied: 'There is Yan Hui who is diligent in study, does not transfer anger, does not repeat errors.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius replied: 'There is Yanyuan, who is diligent in learning. He does not transfer his anger to others, nor does he repeat his mistakes.

sentences.zh: 不幸短命死矣，今也則亡。」

translations.literal: Unfortunately died young, now there is none.'
translations.idiomatic: Unfortunately he died young. Now there is no one like him.''

translations.literal: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which disciple is diligent in study?' Confucius replied: 'There is Yan Hui who is diligent in study, does not transfer anger, does not repeat errors. Unfortunately died young, now there is none.'
Min Sun styled Zi Qian.
translations.idiomatic: Min Sun was styled Ziqian.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by fifteen years.
translations.idiomatic: He was fifteen years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Min Sun styled Zi Qian. Younger than Confucius by fifteen years.
Confucius said: 'Filial indeed is Min Zi Qian!
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'How filial Min Ziqian is!

sentences.zh: 人不閒於其父母昆弟之言。」

translations.literal: People do not find fault in the words of his parents and brothers.'
translations.idiomatic: People do not find fault with what his parents and siblings say.''

sentences.zh: 不仕大夫，不食汙君之祿。

translations.literal: Did not serve grand masters, did not eat the salary of corrupt rulers.
translations.idiomatic: Did not serve grand masters, nor eat corrupt rulers' salary.

translations.literal: 'If there are those who call me back, it must be above the Wen.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If anyone calls me back, it will surely be from above the Wen River.''

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Filial indeed is Min Zi Qian! People do not find fault in the words of his parents and brothers.' Did not serve grand masters, did not eat the salary of corrupt rulers. 'If there are those who call me back, it must be above the Wen.'
Ran Geng styled Bo Niu.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Geng was styled Boniu.

translations.literal: Confucius considered him to have moral conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered him to possess virtue.

translations.literal: Ran Geng styled Bo Niu. Confucius considered him to have moral conduct.

sentences.zh: 伯牛有惡疾，孔子往問之，自牖執其手，曰：「命也夫！

translations.literal: Bo Niu had a serious illness, Confucius went to visit him, from the window grasped his hand, said: 'Fate it is!
translations.idiomatic: Boniu had a serious illness. Confucius went to visit him and grasped his hand through the window, saying: 'It is fate!

sentences.zh: 斯人也而有斯疾，命也夫！」

translations.literal: This person has this illness, fate it is!'
translations.idiomatic: Such a person to have such an illness—it is fate!''

translations.literal: Bo Niu had a serious illness, Confucius went to visit him, from the window grasped his hand, said: 'Fate it is! This person has this illness, fate it is!'
Ran Yong styled Zhong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Yong was styled Zhonggong.

translations.literal: Ran Yong styled Zhong Gong.

sentences.zh: 仲弓問政，孔子曰：「出門如見大賓，使民如承大祭。

translations.literal: Zhong Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'When going out treat as meeting great guests, when employing people treat as conducting great sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Zhonggong asked about governance. Confucius said: 'When going abroad, treat it as meeting great guests. When employing the people, treat it as conducting a great sacrifice.

translations.literal: In the state no resentment, in the home no resentment.'
translations.idiomatic: No resentment in state, no resentment at home.''

translations.literal: Zhong Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'When going out treat as meeting great guests, when employing people treat as conducting great sacrifice. In the state no resentment, in the home no resentment.'

sentences.zh: 孔子以仲弓為有德行，曰：「雍也可使南面。」

translations.literal: Confucius considered Zhong Gong to have moral conduct, said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered Zhonggong to possess virtue and said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'

translations.literal: Confucius considered Zhong Gong to have moral conduct, said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'
Zhong Gong's father was a commoner.
translations.idiomatic: Zhonggong's father was of humble birth.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「犁牛之子騂且角，雖欲勿用，山川其舍諸？」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "The son of a plow ox is reddish and has horns, though one wishes not to use it, will the mountains and rivers abandon it?"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'The calf of a plow ox is reddish and has horns. Though one might wish not to use it, would the mountains and rivers reject it?'

translations.literal: Zhong Gong's father was a commoner. Confucius said: "The son of a plow ox is reddish and has horns, though one wishes not to use it, will the mountains and rivers abandon it?"

sentences.zh: 冉求字子有，少孔子二十九歲。

translations.literal: Ran Qiu styled Ziyou, younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Qiu was styled Ziyou. He was twenty-nine years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Served as steward for the Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: He served as steward for the Ji clan.

translations.literal: Ran Qiu styled Ziyou, younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years. Served as steward for the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 季康子問孔子曰：「冉求仁乎？」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked Confucius: "Is Ran Qiu benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kangzi asked Confucius: 'Is Ran Qiu benevolent?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「千室之邑，百乘之家，求也可使治其賦。

translations.literal: Said: "For a town of a thousand households, a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their taxes.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'For a town of a thousand households or a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their revenues.

translations.literal: As for benevolence, I do not know."
translations.idiomatic: As for benevolence, I do not know.''

translations.literal: Asked again: "Is Zi Lu benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: He asked again: 'Is Zilu benevolent?'

translations.literal: Confucius replied: "Like Qiu."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius replied: 'Like Qiu.'

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked Confucius: "Is Ran Qiu benevolent?" Said: "For a town of a thousand households, a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their taxes. As for benevolence, I do not know." Asked again: "Is Zi Lu benevolent?" Confucius replied: "Like Qiu."
Qiu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"
translations.idiomatic: Qiu asked: 'Having heard this, should one act on it?'

translations.literal: The Master said: "Act."
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Act on it.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked: 'Having heard this, should one act on it?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「有父兄在，如之何其聞斯行之！」

translations.literal: The Master said: "With father and elder brothers present, how can one having heard act on it!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'If one's father and elder brothers are still alive, how can one act on something one has heard?'

sentences.zh: 子華怪之，「敢問問同而答異？」

translations.literal: Zi Hua was puzzled, "Dare ask why questions same but answers different?"
translations.idiomatic: Zihua was puzzled and asked: 'May I ask why the questions were the same but the answers different?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Qiu retreats, therefore advance him.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Qiu is hesitant, so I encourage him forward.

translations.literal: You is overbearing, therefore restrain him."
translations.idiomatic: You is overbearing, so I hold him back.'

translations.literal: Qiu asked: "Having heard, act on it?" The Master said: "Act." Zi Lu asked: "Having heard, act on it?" The Master said: "With father and elder brothers present, how can one having heard act on it!" Zi Hua was puzzled, "Dare ask why questions same but answers different?" Confucius said: "Qiu retreats, therefore advance him. You is overbearing, therefore restrain him."
Zhong You styled Zi Lu, a Bian man.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong You, whose courtesy name was Zilu, was a man from Bian.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by nine years.
translations.idiomatic: He was nine years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Zhong You styled Zi Lu, a Bian man. Younger than Confucius by nine years.

sentences.zh: 子路性鄙，好勇力，志伉直，冠雄雞，佩豭豚，陵暴孔子。

translations.literal: Zi Lu nature was coarse, fond of bravery and strength, his will upright and unyielding, wore a cap with fighting cock, carried a piglet sword, bullied Confucius.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu had a coarse nature. He loved courage and physical strength. His ambitions were upright and unyielding. He wore a cap decorated with a fighting cock and carried a sword with a piglet hilt. He bullied Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子設禮稍誘子路，子路後儒服委質，因門人請為弟子。

translations.literal: Confucius established ritual to gradually guide Zi Lu, Zi Lu later wore Confucian robes and presented introductory gifts, became a disciple.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius used ritual to gradually entice Zilu. Later, Zilu donned Confucian robes and presented the introductory gifts. Through his disciples, he requested to become a student.

translations.literal: Zi Lu nature was coarse, fond of bravery and strength, his will upright and unyielding, wore a cap with fighting cock, carried a piglet sword, bullied Confucius. Confucius established ritual to gradually guide Zi Lu, Zi Lu later wore Confucian robes and presented introductory gifts, became a disciple.

sentences.zh: 子路問政，孔子曰：「先之，勞之。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked about governance, Confucius said: "Lead them, labor them."
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked about governing. Confucius said: 'Lead them. Make them work.'

translations.literal: Requested more.
translations.idiomatic: He asked for more advice.

translations.literal: Said: "Do not tire."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Do not grow weary.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked about governance, Confucius said: "Lead them, labor them." Requested more. Said: "Do not tire."
Zi Lu asked: "Does the gentleman value bravery?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked: 'Does the gentleman prize courage?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Righteousness is paramount.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Righteousness is the highest virtue.

sentences.zh: 君子好勇而無義則亂，小人好勇而無義則盜。」

translations.literal: If a gentleman loves bravery but lacks righteousness then chaos, if a petty man loves bravery but lacks righteousness then theft."
translations.idiomatic: If a gentleman loves courage but lacks righteousness, he will cause disorder. If a petty man loves courage but lacks righteousness, he will become a bandit.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked: "Does the gentleman value bravery?" Confucius said: "Righteousness is paramount. If a gentleman loves bravery but lacks righteousness then chaos, if a petty man loves bravery but lacks righteousness then theft."

sentences.zh: 子路有聞，未之能行，唯恐有聞。

translations.literal: Zi Lu upon hearing, feared not being able to practice, only feared not hearing.
translations.idiomatic: When Zilu heard something, he feared he would not be able to practice it. His only fear was not hearing it.

translations.literal: Zi Lu upon hearing, feared not being able to practice, only feared not hearing.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「片言可以折獄者，其由也與！」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "One who can judge cases with a single phrase, it is You!"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'The one who can resolve legal disputes with just a single statement—that would be You!'

translations.literal: "You loves bravery exceeding me, nothing to take as material."
translations.idiomatic: 'You loves courage more than I do, but there's nothing to be gained from it.'

translations.literal: "If You, will not obtain proper death."
translations.idiomatic: 'As for You, he will not die a natural death.'

sentences.zh: 「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與！」

translations.literal: "One who wears ragged silk robe, stands with those wearing fox and badger furs without shame, it is You!"
translations.idiomatic: 'The one who wears a tattered silk robe and stands among those dressed in fox and badger furs without feeling ashamed—that would be You!'

translations.literal: "You has ascended the hall, has not yet entered the inner chamber."
translations.idiomatic: 'You has entered the main hall but not yet reached the inner chambers.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "One who can judge cases with a single phrase, it is You!" "You loves bravery exceeding me, nothing to take as material." "If You, will not obtain proper death." "One who wears ragged silk robe, stands with those wearing fox and badger furs without shame, it is You!" "You has ascended the hall, has not yet entered the inner chamber."
Ji Kang Zi asked: "Is Zhong You benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kangzi asked: 'Is Zhong You benevolent?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「千乘之國可使治其賦，不知其仁。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "For a state of thousand chariots he can be made to manage taxes, do not know his benevolence."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'For a state with a thousand chariots, he could be put in charge of tax collection. I do not know about his benevolence.'

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked: "Is Zhong You benevolent?" Confucius said: "For a state of thousand chariots he can be made to manage taxes, do not know his benevolence."

sentences.zh: 子路喜從游，遇長沮、桀溺、荷蓧丈人。

translations.literal: Zi Lu delighted in following on excursions, encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, He Tao Elder.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu loved accompanying Confucius on his travels. He encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, and the old man carrying a basket.

translations.literal: Zi Lu delighted in following on excursions, encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, He Tao Elder.

sentences.zh: 子路為季氏宰，季孫問曰：「子路可謂大臣與？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as steward for Ji clan, Ji Sun asked: "Can Zi Lu be called a great minister?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu served as steward for the Ji family. Jisun asked: 'Can Zilu be called a great minister?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Can be called a complete minister."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'He can be called a capable minister.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as steward for Ji clan, Ji Sun asked: "Can Zi Lu be called a great minister?" Confucius said: "Can be called a complete minister."
Zi Lu served as magistrate of Pu, took leave from Confucius.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu became magistrate of Pu and took his leave from Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「蒲多壯士，又難治。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Pu has many strong men, moreover difficult to govern.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Pu has many strong men, and it is difficult to govern.

sentences.zh: 然吾語汝：恭以敬，可以執勇；

translations.literal: However I tell you: With respect and reverence can control bravery;
translations.idiomatic: But let me tell you: With courtesy and respect, you can harness courage.

translations.literal: With generosity and uprightness can unite the multitude;
translations.idiomatic: With generosity and righteousness, you can unite the people.

translations.literal: With respect and uprightness and calm can serve superiors."
translations.idiomatic: With courtesy, righteousness, and composure, you can serve your superiors.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as magistrate of Pu, took leave from Confucius. Confucius said: "Pu has many strong men, moreover difficult to govern. However I tell you: With respect and reverence can control bravery; With generosity and uprightness can unite the multitude; With respect and uprightness and calm can serve superiors."

sentences.zh: 初，衛靈公有寵姬曰南子。

translations.literal: Initially, Duke Ling of Wei had a favored concubine named Nan Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the beginning, Duke Ling of Wei had a favored concubine named Nanzi.

sentences.zh: 靈公太子蕢聵得過南子，懼誅出奔。

translations.literal: Duke Ling crown prince Kui Tun offended Nan Zi, feared execution fled.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling's crown prince Kuitun offended Nanzi, feared execution, and fled.

sentences.zh: 及靈公卒而夫人欲立公子郢。

translations.literal: When Duke Ling died the consort wished to establish Prince Ying.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Ling died, his consort wished to establish Prince Ying as ruler.

sentences.zh: 郢不肯，曰：「亡人太子之子輒在。」

translations.literal: Ying refused, said: "The fugitive crown prince son Zhe is here."
translations.idiomatic: Ying refused, saying: 'The son of the exiled crown prince, Zhe, is still here.'

sentences.zh: 於是衛立輒為君，是為出公。

translations.literal: Then Wei established Zhe as ruler, this was Duke Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Wei established Zhe as ruler. He was known as Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公立十二年，其父蕢聵居外，不得入。

translations.literal: Duke Chu established twelve years, his father Kui Tun dwelt outside, could not enter.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu ruled for twelve years. His father Kuitun lived outside the state and could not enter.

sentences.zh: 子路為衛大夫孔悝之邑宰。

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as magistrate of Kong Kui yi for Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu served as magistrate of the town belonging to Kong Kui, a Wei grandee.

sentences.zh: 蕢聵乃與孔悝作亂，謀入孔悝家，遂與其徒襲攻出公。

translations.literal: Kui Tun then with Kong Kui made rebellion, planned to enter Kong Kui home, then with his followers attacked Duke Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Kuitun then joined Kong Kui in rebellion. They planned to enter Kong Kui's house and then led their followers in a surprise attack on Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公奔魯，而蕢聵入立，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Duke Chu fled to Lu, Kui Tun entered established, this was Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu fled to Lu, while Kuitun entered the capital and established himself as ruler. He was known as Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 方孔悝作亂，子路在外，聞之而馳往。

translations.literal: When Kong Kui made rebellion, Zi Lu outside, heard it galloped go.
translations.idiomatic: When Kong Kui began his rebellion, Zilu was outside the city. He heard about it and galloped back.

sentences.zh: 遇子羔出衛城門，謂子路曰：「出公去矣，而門已閉，子可還矣，毋空受其禍。」

translations.literal: Met Zi Gao leaving Wei city gate, told Zi Lu: "Duke Chu gone, gate already closed, you can return, do not vainly receive calamity."
translations.idiomatic: He met Zigao leaving the Wei city gate, who told Zilu: 'Duke Chu has fled, and the gates are already closed. You should turn back and not needlessly court disaster.'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「食其食者不避其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: "One who eats his food does not avoid his difficulties."
translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'One who eats his master's food does not shirk his master's troubles.'

translations.literal: Zi Gao finally left.
translations.idiomatic: Zigao finally left.

sentences.zh: 有使者入城，城門開，子路隨而入。

translations.literal: Had envoy enter city, city gate opened, Zi Lu followed entered.
translations.idiomatic: An envoy arrived to enter the city. The city gate opened, and Zilu followed him in.

sentences.zh: 造蕢聵，蕢聵與孔悝登臺。

translations.literal: Approached Kui Tun, Kui Tun with Kong Kui ascended tower.
translations.idiomatic: He approached Kuitun, who had ascended a tower with Kong Kui.

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: "Ruler why use Kong Kui?
translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'Why does the ruler need Kong Kui?

translations.literal: Please obtain and kill him."
translations.idiomatic: Please let me get him and kill him.'

translations.literal: Kui Tun not listened.
translations.idiomatic: Kuitun would not listen.

sentences.zh: 於是子路欲燔臺，蕢聵懼，乃下石乞、壺黶攻子路，擊斷子路之纓。

translations.literal: Then Zi Lu wished to burn tower, Kui Tun feared, then sent Shi Qi, Hu Xian attack Zi Lu, struck broke Zi Lu hat string.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu then wanted to set fire to the tower. Kuitun became afraid and sent Shi Qi and Hu Xian to attack Zilu, striking and breaking Zilu's hat cord.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「君子死而冠不免。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: "Gentleman dies cap not removed."
translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'A gentleman does not remove his cap even in death.'

translations.literal: Then tied hat string died.
translations.idiomatic: He then tied his hat cord and died.

translations.literal: Initially, Duke Ling of Wei had a favored concubine named Nan Zi. Duke Ling crown prince Kui Tun offended Nan Zi, feared execution fled. When Duke Ling died the consort wished to establish Prince Ying. Ying refused, said: "The fugitive crown prince son Zhe is here." Then Wei established Zhe as ruler, this was Duke Chu. Duke Chu established twelve years, his father Kui Tun dwelt outside, could not enter. Zi Lu served as magistrate of Kong Kui yi for Wei. Kui Tun then with Kong Kui made rebellion, planned to enter Kong Kui home, then with his followers attacked Duke Chu. Duke Chu fled to Lu, Kui Tun entered established, this was Duke Zhuang. When Kong Kui made rebellion, Zi Lu outside, heard it galloped go. Met Zi Gao leaving Wei city gate, told Zi Lu: "Duke Chu gone, gate already closed, you can return, do not vainly receive calamity." Zi Lu said: "One who eats his food does not avoid his difficulties." Zi Gao finally left. Had envoy enter city, city gate opened, Zi Lu followed entered. Approached Kui Tun, Kui Tun with Kong Kui ascended tower. Zi Lu said: "Ruler why use Kong Kui? Please obtain and kill him." Kui Tun not listened. Then Zi Lu wished to burn tower, Kui Tun feared, then sent Shi Qi, Hu Xian attack Zi Lu, struck broke Zi Lu hat string. Zi Lu said: "Gentleman dies cap not removed." Then tied hat string died.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞衛亂，曰：「嗟乎，由死矣！」

translations.literal: Confucius heard Wei chaos, said: "Alas, You died!"
translations.idiomatic: When Confucius heard of the chaos in Wei, he said: 'Alas, You has died!'

translations.literal: Afterward indeed died.
translations.idiomatic: And indeed he died.

sentences.zh: 故孔子曰：「自吾得由，惡言不聞於耳。」

translations.literal: Therefore Confucius said: "Since I obtained You, evil words not heard at ears."
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Confucius said: 'Ever since I obtained You, evil words have not reached my ears.'

translations.literal: At this time Zi Gong as Lu envoy to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Zigong was serving as Lu's envoy to Qi.

translations.literal: Confucius heard Wei chaos, said: "Alas, You died!" Afterward indeed died. Therefore Confucius said: "Since I obtained You, evil words not heard at ears." At this time Zi Gong as Lu envoy to Qi.
Zai Yu styled Zi Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Zai Yu, whose courtesy name was Ziwo.

translations.literal: Sharp tongue eloquent speech.
translations.idiomatic: He had a sharp tongue and eloquent speech.

sentences.zh: 既受業，問：「三年之喪不已久乎？

translations.literal: Having received teachings, asked: "Three years mourning not too long?
translations.idiomatic: After receiving his teachings, he asked: 'Is the three-year mourning period not too long?'

sentences.zh: 君子三年不為禮，禮必壞；

translations.literal: Gentleman three years not practice ritual, ritual must decay;
translations.idiomatic: 'If a gentleman does not practice ritual for three years, ritual will surely decay;'

translations.literal: Three years not practice music, music must collapse.
translations.idiomatic: 'if he does not practice music for three years, music will surely collapse.'

sentences.zh: 舊穀既沒，新穀既升，鉆燧改火，期可已矣。」

translations.literal: Old grain already exhausted, new grain already ascended, flint fire changed, period can stop."
translations.idiomatic: 'The old grain is already exhausted, the new grain has already been harvested, and the flint fire has been changed. The period can come to an end.'

translations.literal: Master said: "Are you at peace?"
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Are you at peace with this?'

translations.literal: Said: "At peace."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I am at peace.'

translations.literal: "You at peace then do it.
translations.idiomatic: 'If you are at peace with it, then do it.

sentences.zh: 君子居喪，食旨不甘，聞樂不樂，故弗為也。」

translations.literal: Gentleman in mourning, delicious food not sweet, hearing music not joyful, therefore not do."
translations.idiomatic: When a gentleman is in mourning, delicious food does not taste sweet to him, and hearing music does not bring him joy. Therefore we do not practice it.'

sentences.zh: 宰我出，子曰：「予之不仁也！

translations.literal: Zai Wo left, Master said: "Yu not benevolent!
translations.idiomatic: After Zaiwo left, the Master said: 'Yu is not benevolent!'

sentences.zh: 子生三年然後免於父母之懷。

translations.literal: Child born three years then free from parents embrace.
translations.idiomatic: 'A child is born and only after three years is free from his parents' embrace.'

sentences.zh: 夫三年之喪，天下之通義也。」

translations.literal: Three years mourning, world universal righteousness."
translations.idiomatic: 'The three-year mourning period is the universal righteousness of the world.'

translations.literal: Zai Yu styled Zi Wo. Sharp tongue eloquent speech. Having received teachings, asked: "Three years mourning not too long? Gentleman three years not practice ritual, ritual must decay; Three years not practice music, music must collapse. Old grain already exhausted, new grain already ascended, flint fire changed, period can stop." Master said: "Are you at peace?" Said: "At peace." "You at peace then do it. Gentleman in mourning, delicious food not sweet, hearing music not joyful, therefore not do." Zai Wo left, Master said: "Yu not benevolent! Child born three years then free from parents embrace. Three years mourning, world universal righteousness."
Zai Wo daytime slept.
translations.idiomatic: Zaiwo slept during the day.

sentences.zh: 子曰：「朽木不可雕也，糞土之墻不可圬也。」

translations.literal: Master said: "Rotten wood cannot carve, manure wall cannot plaster."
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Rotten wood cannot be carved, and a wall of manure cannot be plastered.'

translations.literal: Zai Wo daytime slept. Master said: "Rotten wood cannot carve, manure wall cannot plaster."

sentences.zh: 宰我問五帝之德，子曰：「予非其人也。」

translations.literal: Zai Wo asked Five Emperors virtue, Master said: "I not that person."
translations.idiomatic: Zaiwo asked about the virtue of the Five Emperors. The Master said: 'I am not that kind of person.'

translations.literal: Zai Wo asked Five Emperors virtue, Master said: "I not that person."

sentences.zh: 宰我為臨菑大夫，與田常作亂，以夷其族，孔子恥之。

translations.literal: Zai Wo became Lin Zi grand master, with Tian Chang made rebellion, exterminated his clan, Confucius ashamed.
translations.idiomatic: Zaiwo became grand master of Linzi and joined Tian Chang in rebellion, which led to the extermination of his clan. Confucius was ashamed of him.

translations.literal: Zai Wo became Lin Zi grand master, with Tian Chang made rebellion, exterminated his clan, Confucius ashamed.
Duanmu Ci, Wei man, styled Zi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duanmu Ci was a man from Wei, whose courtesy name was Zigong.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty-one years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty-one years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Duanmu Ci, Wei man, styled Zi Gong. Younger than Confucius by thirty-one years.

sentences.zh: 子貢利口巧辭，孔子常黜其辯。

translations.literal: Zi Gong sharp tongue clever speech, Confucius often suppressed his eloquence.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong had a sharp tongue and clever speech. Confucius often suppressed his eloquence.

translations.literal: Asked: "You and Hui which better?"
translations.idiomatic: He asked: 'Which of you and Hui is better?'

translations.literal: Replied: "Ci how dare hope Hui!
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'How dare Ci hope to equal Hui!'

sentences.zh: 回也聞一以知十，賜也聞一以知二。」

translations.literal: Hui hears one knows ten, Ci hears one knows two."
translations.idiomatic: 'Hui hears one thing and understands ten. Ci hears one thing and understands two.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong sharp tongue clever speech, Confucius often suppressed his eloquence. Asked: "You and Hui which better?" Replied: "Ci how dare hope Hui! Hui hears one knows ten, Ci hears one knows two."

sentences.zh: 子貢既已受業，問曰：「賜何人也？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong having received teachings, asked: "Ci what person?"
translations.idiomatic: After Zigong had received his teachings, he asked: 'What kind of person is Ci?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "You vessel."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'You are a vessel.'

translations.literal: Said: "What vessel?"
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'What kind of vessel?'

translations.literal: Said: "Hu lian."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'A sacrificial vessel.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong having received teachings, asked: "Ci what person?" Confucius said: "You vessel." Said: "What vessel?" Said: "Hu lian."

sentences.zh: 陳子禽問子貢曰：「仲尼焉學？」

translations.literal: Chen Zi Qin asked Zi Gong: "Zhong Ni where learn?"
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ziqin asked Zigong: 'Where did Zhongni study?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「文武之道未墜於地，在人，賢者識其大者，不賢者識其小者，莫不有文武之道。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Wen Wu way not fallen to earth, in people, worthy identify large, unworthy identify small, none not have Wen Wu way.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'The Way of Wen and Wu has not fallen to the earth. It is among people. The worthy recognize the great parts, the unworthy recognize the small parts. No one lacks some part of the Way of Wen and Wu.

sentences.zh: 夫子焉不學，而亦何常師之有！」

translations.literal: Master where not learn, moreover what constant teacher have!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master learns from everyone. What constant teacher does he have!'

sentences.zh: 又問曰：「孔子適是國必聞其政。

translations.literal: Again asked: "Confucius go this state must hear its governance.
translations.idiomatic: He asked again: 'Whenever Confucius goes to a state, he always hears about its governance.

translations.literal: Seek it?
translations.idiomatic: Does he seek it?

translations.literal: Or given it?"
translations.idiomatic: Or is it given to him?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子溫、良、恭、儉、讓以得之。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Master warm, good, respectful, frugal, yielding with get it.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'The Master obtains it through being warm, good, respectful, frugal, and yielding.

sentences.zh: 夫子之求之也，其諸異乎人之求之也。」

translations.literal: Master seek it, perhaps different from people seek it."
translations.idiomatic: The Master's way of seeking it is perhaps different from how ordinary people seek it.'

translations.literal: Chen Zi Qin asked Zi Gong: "Zhong Ni where learn?" Zi Gong said: "Wen Wu way not fallen to earth, in people, worthy identify large, unworthy identify small, none not have Wen Wu way. Master where not learn, moreover what constant teacher have!" Again asked: "Confucius go this state must hear its governance. Seek it? Or given it?" Zi Gong said: "Master warm, good, respectful, frugal, yielding with get it. Master seek it, perhaps different from people seek it."

sentences.zh: 子貢問曰：「富而無驕，貧而無諂，何如？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong asked: "Rich without arrogance, poor without flattery, how?"
translations.idiomatic: Zigong asked: 'What do you think of being rich without arrogance and poor without flattery?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Can;
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'That is acceptable;

sentences.zh: 不如貧而樂道，富而好禮。」

translations.literal: Not as poor yet joyful in Way, rich yet fond of ritual."
translations.idiomatic: but it is not as good as being poor yet joyful in the Way, or rich yet fond of ritual.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong asked: "Rich without arrogance, poor without flattery, how?" Confucius said: "Can; Not as poor yet joyful in Way, rich yet fond of ritual."

sentences.zh: 田常欲作亂於齊，憚高、國、鮑、晏，故移其兵欲以伐魯。

translations.literal: Tian Chang wished make rebellion in Qi, feared Gao, Guo, Bao, Yan, therefore moved his troops wished attack Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang wanted to make rebellion in Qi, but he feared the Gao, Guo, Bao, and Yan families. Therefore he moved his troops and planned to attack Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞之，謂門弟子曰：「夫魯，墳墓所處，父母之國，國危如此，二三子何為莫出？」

translations.literal: Confucius heard it, told gate disciples: "Lu, tombs place, parents country, country danger thus, you several why not go out?"
translations.idiomatic: When Confucius heard this, he told his disciples: 'Lu is where our tombs are, our ancestral homeland. The country is in such danger—why do none of you go out?'

translations.literal: Zi Lu requested go out, Confucius stopped him.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu requested to go out, but Confucius stopped him.

sentences.zh: 子張、子石請行，孔子弗許。

translations.literal: Zi Zhang, Zi Shi requested go, Confucius not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: Zizhang and Zishi requested to go, but Confucius did not permit them.

translations.literal: Zi Gong requested go, Confucius permitted him.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong requested to go, and Confucius permitted him.

translations.literal: Tian Chang wished make rebellion in Qi, feared Gao, Guo, Bao, Yan, therefore moved his troops wished attack Lu. Confucius heard it, told gate disciples: "Lu, tombs place, parents country, country danger thus, you several why not go out?" Zi Lu requested go out, Confucius stopped him. Zi Zhang, Zi Shi requested go, Confucius not permitted. Zi Gong requested go, Confucius permitted him.

sentences.zh: 遂行，至齊，說田常曰：「君之伐魯過矣。

translations.literal: Then went, arrived Qi, advised Tian Chang: "Jun attack Lu wrong.
translations.idiomatic: He then went and arrived in Qi, where he advised Tian Chang: 'Your attack on Lu is a mistake.

sentences.zh: 夫魯，難伐之國，其城薄以卑，其地狹以泄，其君愚而不仁，大臣偽而無用，其士民又惡甲兵之事，此不可與戰。

translations.literal: Lu, difficult attack country, its city thin with low, its land narrow with leaking, its jun foolish not benevolent, ministers false without use, its scholars people moreover hate armor weapons matters, this cannot battle with.
translations.idiomatic: Lu is a difficult country to attack. Its walls are thin and low, its land narrow and poorly defended. Its ruler is foolish and unkind, its ministers hypocritical and useless. Its scholars and people hate military affairs. This is not a country one can fight.'

translations.literal: Jun better attack Wu.
translations.idiomatic: You would do better to attack Wu.

sentences.zh: 夫吳，城高以厚，地廣以深，甲堅以新，士選以飽，重器精兵盡在其中，又使明大夫守之，此易伐也。」

translations.literal: Wu, city high with thick, land broad with deep, armor firm with new, soldiers selected with full, heavy equipment elite troops all in midst, moreover make bright grand master guard it, this easy attack."
translations.idiomatic: Wu has high and thick walls, broad and deep territory. Its armor is firm and new, its soldiers selected and well-fed. All its heavy equipment and elite troops are concentrated there, and it is guarded by a wise grand master. This would be easy to attack.'

sentences.zh: 田常忿然作色曰：「子之所難，人之所易；

translations.literal: Tian Chang angrily changed color: "You what difficult, people what easy;
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang angrily changed color and said: 'What you find difficult, others find easy;'

sentences.zh: 子之所易，人之所難：而以教常，何也？」

translations.literal: You what easy, people what difficult: with teach Chang, why?"
translations.idiomatic: 'what you find easy, others find difficult. Why do you teach this to Chang?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「臣聞之，憂在內者攻彊，憂在外者攻弱。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Subject heard, worry internal attack strong, worry external attack weak.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'I have heard that those whose worries are internal attack the strong, while those whose worries are external attack the weak.

translations.literal: Now jun worry internal.
translations.idiomatic: Now your worries are internal.

sentences.zh: 吾聞君三封而三不成者，大臣有不聽者也。

translations.literal: I heard jun three enfeoff three not succeed, ministers have not listen.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that your three attempts at enfeoffment all failed because your ministers would not listen.'

sentences.zh: 今君破魯以廣齊，戰勝以驕主，破國以尊臣，而君之功不與焉，則交日疏於主。

translations.literal: Now jun break Lu to broaden Qi, battle victory to make jun arrogant, break country to honor ministers, jun merit not share, then relation daily distant from jun.
translations.idiomatic: Now if you defeat Lu to enlarge Qi, victory in battle will make your ruler arrogant, destroying a state will honor your ministers, but you will share none of the merit. Your relations with your ruler will grow more distant each day.'

sentences.zh: 是君上驕主心，下恣群臣，求以成大事，難矣。

translations.literal: This jun above arrogant jun heart, below indulge ministers, seek accomplish great matters, difficult.
translations.idiomatic: 'This will make your ruler arrogant above and indulge your ministers below. Seeking to accomplish great matters will be difficult.'

sentences.zh: 夫上驕則恣，臣驕則爭，是君上與主有卻，下與大臣交爭也。

translations.literal: Jun arrogant then indulgent, ministers arrogant then contend, this jun above with jun have retreat, below with ministers contend.
translations.idiomatic: 'When superiors become arrogant they become indulgent, when ministers become arrogant they contend. This means you will retreat above from your ruler and contend below with your ministers.'

sentences.zh: 如此，則君之立於齊危矣。

translations.literal: Thus, jun stand in Qi dangerous.
translations.idiomatic: 'In this way, your position in Qi will be in danger.'

translations.literal: Therefore say better attack Wu.
translations.idiomatic: 'Therefore I say it is better to attack Wu.'

sentences.zh: 伐吳不勝，民人外死，大臣內空，是君上無彊臣之敵，下無民人之過，孤主制齊者唯君也。」

translations.literal: Attack Wu not victorious, people external die, ministers internal empty, this jun above without strong minister enemy, below without people fault, isolated jun control Qi only jun."
translations.idiomatic: 'If you attack Wu and are not victorious, your people will die abroad and your ministers will be emptied at home. This means above you will have no strong ministers as enemies, below you will have no fault from the people. The isolated ruler controlling Qi will be only you.'

translations.literal: Tian Chang said: "Good.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang said: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 雖然，吾兵業已加魯矣，去而之吳，大臣疑我，柰何？」

translations.literal: Although, my troops already added to Lu, depart go Wu, ministers suspect me, what to do?"
translations.idiomatic: Although, my troops have already been committed to Lu. If I withdraw and go to Wu, my ministers will suspect me. What should I do?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「君按兵無伐，臣請往使吳王，令之救魯而伐齊，君因以兵迎之。」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Jun hold troops not attack, subject please go make Wu wang, order him save Lu attack Qi, jun then with troops welcome him."
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'My lord should hold his troops and not attack. I will go and persuade the King of Wu to save Lu and attack Qi. My lord can then meet him with troops.'

sentences.zh: 田常許之，使子貢南見吳王。

translations.literal: Tian Chang permitted, made Zi Gong south see Wu wang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang agreed and sent Zigong south to see the King of Wu.

translations.literal: Then went, arrived Qi, advised Tian Chang: "Jun attack Lu wrong. Lu, difficult attack country, its city thin with low, its land narrow with leaking, its jun foolish not benevolent, ministers false without use, its scholars people moreover hate armor weapons matters, this cannot battle with. Jun better attack Wu. Wu, city high with thick, land broad with deep, armor firm with new, soldiers selected with full, heavy equipment elite troops all in midst, moreover make bright grand master guard it, this easy attack." Tian Chang angrily changed color: "You what difficult, people what easy; You what easy, people what difficult: with teach Chang, why?" Zi Gong said: "Subject heard, worry internal attack strong, worry external attack weak. Now jun worry internal. I heard jun three enfeoff three not succeed, ministers have not listen. Now jun break Lu to broaden Qi, battle victory to make jun arrogant, break country to honor ministers, jun merit not share, then relation daily distant from jun. This jun above arrogant jun heart, below indulge ministers, seek accomplish great matters, difficult. Jun arrogant then indulgent, ministers arrogant then contend, this jun above with jun have retreat, below with ministers contend. Thus, jun stand in Qi dangerous. Therefore say better attack Wu. Attack Wu not victorious, people external die, ministers internal empty, this jun above without strong minister enemy, below without people fault, isolated jun control Qi only jun." Tian Chang said: "Good. Although, my troops already added to Lu, depart go Wu, ministers suspect me, what to do?" Zi Gong said: "Jun hold troops not attack, subject please go make Wu wang, order him save Lu attack Qi, jun then with troops welcome him." Tian Chang permitted, made Zi Gong south see Wu wang.

sentences.zh: 說曰：「臣聞之，王者不絕世，霸者無彊敵，千鈞之重加銖兩而移。

translations.literal: Advised: "Subject heard, wang not cut off generations, ba no strong enemy, thousand jun weight add zhu liang then move.
translations.idiomatic: He advised: 'I have heard that kings do not cut off lineages, hegemons have no strong enemies. A weight of a thousand jun will move when just a zhu liang is added.

sentences.zh: 今以萬乘之齊而私千乘之魯，與吳爭彊，竊為王危之。

translations.literal: Now with ten thousand chariots Qi privately thousand chariots Lu, with Wu contend strong, secretly for wang dangerous.
translations.idiomatic: Now a Qi with ten thousand chariots is privately helping a Lu with a thousand chariots, contending with Wu for strength. I secretly consider this dangerous for your majesty.'

translations.literal: Moreover save Lu, manifest name;
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, saving Lu will manifest your name;'

translations.literal: Attack Qi, great profit.
translations.idiomatic: 'attacking Qi will bring great profit.'

sentences.zh: 以撫泗上諸侯，誅暴齊以服彊晉，利莫大焉。

translations.literal: With pacify Si Shang feudal lords, execute violent Qi to submit strong Jin, profit none greater.
translations.idiomatic: 'With this you can pacify the feudal lords along the Si River, execute the violent Qi to submit the strong Jin. No profit could be greater.'

translations.literal: Name preserve perish Lu, reality exhaust strong Qi.
translations.idiomatic: 'In name you preserve the perishing Lu, in reality you exhaust the strong Qi.'

translations.literal: Wise not doubt."
translations.idiomatic: 'The wise do not doubt this.'

translations.literal: Wu wang said: "Good.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu said: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 雖然，吾嘗與越戰，棲之會稽。

translations.literal: Although, I once with Yue battle, made them dwell Kui Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Although, I once battled with Yue and made them dwell at Kuai Ji.

sentences.zh: 越王苦身養士，有報我心。

translations.literal: Yue wang toil body nourish troops, has avenge me heart.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue toils and nourishes troops. He has the heart to avenge me.'

translations.literal: You wait me attack Yue then listen you."
translations.idiomatic: You wait for me to attack Yue, then I will listen to you.'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「越之勁不過魯，吳之彊不過齊，王置齊而伐越，則齊已平魯矣。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Yue strength not exceed Lu, Wu strong not exceed Qi, wang place Qi attack Yue, then Qi already pacify Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'Yue's strength does not exceed Lu's, Wu's power does not exceed Qi's. If your majesty ignores Qi and attacks Yue, then Qi will have already pacified Lu.

sentences.zh: 且王方以存亡繼絕為名，夫伐小越而畏彊齊，非勇也。

translations.literal: Moreover wang just with preserve perish continue cut off as name, attack small Yue fear strong Qi, not brave.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, your majesty has just taken preserving the perishing and continuing the cut off as your name. To attack small Yue but fear strong Qi is not brave.'

sentences.zh: 夫勇者不避難，仁者不窮約，智者不失時，王者不絕世，以立其義。

translations.literal: Brave not avoid difficulty, benevolent not poor frugal, wise not lose time, wang not cut off generations, to establish their righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: 'The brave do not avoid difficulty, the benevolent are not constrained by poverty, the wise do not lose the moment, kings do not cut off lineages—to establish their righteousness.'

sentences.zh: 今存越示諸侯以仁，救魯伐齊，威加晉國，諸侯必相率而朝吳，霸業成矣。

translations.literal: Now preserve Yue show feudal lords benevolence, save Lu attack Qi, awe add Jin state, feudal lords must lead each other court Wu, ba achievement complete.
translations.idiomatic: 'Now preserve Yue to show benevolence to the feudal lords, save Lu and attack Qi, add awe to the state of Jin—the feudal lords will surely lead each other to court Wu, and the hegemon's achievement will be complete.'

sentences.zh: 且王必惡越，臣請東見越王，令出兵以從，此實空越，名從諸侯以伐也。」

translations.literal: Moreover wang must hate Yue, subject please east see Yue wang, make send troops follow, this truly empty Yue, name follow feudal lords attack."
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, your majesty must hate Yue. I will go east to see the King of Yue and make him send troops to follow. This will truly empty Yue, in name following the feudal lords to attack.'

sentences.zh: 吳王大說，乃使子貢之越。

translations.literal: Wu wang greatly pleased, made Zi Gong go Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu was greatly pleased and sent Zigong to Yue.

translations.literal: Advised: "Subject heard, wang not cut off generations, ba no strong enemy, thousand jun weight add zhu liang then move. Now with ten thousand chariots Qi privately thousand chariots Lu, with Wu contend strong, secretly for wang dangerous. Moreover save Lu, manifest name; Attack Qi, great profit. With pacify Si Shang feudal lords, execute violent Qi to submit strong Jin, profit none greater. Name preserve perish Lu, reality exhaust strong Qi. Wise not doubt." Wu wang said: "Good. Although, I once with Yue battle, made them dwell Kui Ji. Yue wang toil body nourish troops, has avenge me heart. You wait me attack Yue then listen you." Zi Gong said: "Yue strength not exceed Lu, Wu strong not exceed Qi, wang place Qi attack Yue, then Qi already pacify Lu. Moreover wang just with preserve perish continue cut off as name, attack small Yue fear strong Qi, not brave. Brave not avoid difficulty, benevolent not poor frugal, wise not lose time, wang not cut off generations, to establish their righteousness. Now preserve Yue show feudal lords benevolence, save Lu attack Qi, awe add Jin state, feudal lords must lead each other court Wu, ba achievement complete. Moreover wang must hate Yue, subject please east see Yue wang, make send troops follow, this truly empty Yue, name follow feudal lords attack." Wu wang greatly pleased, made Zi Gong go Yue.

sentences.zh: 越王除道郊迎，身御至舍而問曰：「此蠻夷之國，大夫何以儼然辱而臨之？」

translations.literal: Yue wang cleared road suburban welcomed, personally drove to lodge asked: "This barbarian yi country, grand master why solemnly condescend visit?"
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue cleared the road and welcomed him in the suburbs. He personally drove to the lodge and asked: 'This is a barbarian Yi country. Why does the grand master solemnly condescend to visit it?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「今者吾說吳王以救魯伐齊，其志欲之而畏越，曰『待我伐越乃可』。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Now I advised Wu wang save Lu attack Qi, his will desire it but fear Yue, said wait me attack Yue then can.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'Now I advised the King of Wu to save Lu and attack Qi. His will desires it but he fears Yue, saying "Wait for me to attack Yue, then it can be done."'

translations.literal: Thus, break Yue certain.
translations.idiomatic: In this way, defeating Yue is certain.'

sentences.zh: 且夫無報人之志而令人疑之，拙也；

translations.literal: Moreover without avenge people will make people suspect it, clumsy;
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, to have no will to avenge people but make them suspect it is clumsy;'

sentences.zh: 有報人之志，使人知之，殆也；

translations.literal: Have avenge people will make people know it, dangerous;
translations.idiomatic: 'to have the will to avenge people but make them know it is dangerous;'

translations.literal: Affair not issue first heard, perilous.
translations.idiomatic: 'for affairs not yet begun to be heard beforehand is perilous.'

translations.literal: Three manage affair great calamity."
translations.idiomatic: 'These three are the great calamities of managing affairs.'

sentences.zh: 句踐頓首再拜曰：「孤嘗不料力，乃與吳戰，困於會稽，痛入於骨髓，日夜焦脣乾舌，徒欲與吳王接踵而死，孤之願也。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian knocked head twice bowed: "Gu once not measure strength, with Wu battle, trapped at Kui Ji, pain entered bone marrow, day night scorched lips dry tongue, only wished with Wu wang connect heels die, gu wish."
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian knocked his head on the ground and bowed twice, saying: 'I once did not measure my strength and battled with Wu. I was trapped at Kuai Ji. The pain entered my bone marrow. Day and night my lips were scorched and my tongue dry. I only wished to follow close on the heels of the King of Wu and die. That was my wish.'

translations.literal: Then asked Zi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He then asked Zigong.

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「吳王為人猛暴，群臣不堪；

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Wu wang fierce violent, ministers cannot bear;
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'The King of Wu is fierce and violent, his ministers cannot bear it;'

sentences.zh: 國家敝以數戰，士卒弗忍；

translations.literal: State depleted from frequent battles, soldiers cannot endure;
translations.idiomatic: 'the state is depleted from frequent battles, the soldiers cannot endure;'

translations.literal: People resent superiors, ministers internally change;
translations.idiomatic: 'the people resent their superiors, the ministers are internally rebellious;'

sentences.zh: 子胥以諫死，太宰嚭用事，順君之過以安其私：是殘國之治也。

translations.literal: Zi Xu died remonstrating, Grand Steward Pi governs, follows jun excesses to secure his private interests: this remnant country governance.
translations.idiomatic: 'Zixu died from remonstrating, Grand Steward Pi governs, follows the ruler's excesses to secure his private interests: this is the governance of a remnant country.'

sentences.zh: 今王誠發士卒佐之徼其志，重寶以說其心，卑辭以尊其禮，其伐齊必也。

translations.literal: Now wang sincerely send troops assist him realize his ambitions, heavy treasures to please his heart, humble words to honor his ritual, his attack Qi certain.
translations.idiomatic: 'Now if your majesty sincerely sends troops to assist him and realize his ambitions, heavy treasures to please his heart, humble words to honor his ritual, his attack on Qi will certainly succeed.'

translations.literal: They battle not victorious, wang blessing.
translations.idiomatic: 'If they do not win the battle, it will be your majesty's blessing.'

sentences.zh: 戰勝，必以兵臨晉，臣請北見晉君，令共攻之，弱吳必矣。

translations.literal: Battle victorious, must with troops approach Jin, subject please north see Jin jun, make jointly attack it, weaken Wu certain.
translations.idiomatic: 'If they win, they will certainly approach Jin with troops. I will go north to see the Jin ruler and make him jointly attack Wu. Weakening Wu will be certain.'

sentences.zh: 其銳兵盡於齊，重甲困於晉，而王制其敝，此滅吳必矣。」

translations.literal: Its sharp troops exhausted at Qi, heavy armor trapped at Jin, wang control their depleted, this extinguish Wu certain."
translations.idiomatic: 'Its sharp troops will be exhausted at Qi, its heavy armor trapped at Jin, and your majesty will control their depleted state. This will certainly extinguish Wu.'

translations.literal: Yue wang greatly pleased, promised.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue was greatly pleased and agreed.

sentences.zh: 送子貢金百鎰，劍一，良矛二。

translations.literal: Sent Zi Gong gold hundred yi, sword one, good spears two.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Zigong a hundred yi of gold, one sword, and two fine spears.

translations.literal: Zi Gong not accepted, then departed.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong did not accept them and departed.

translations.literal: Yue wang cleared road suburban welcomed, personally drove to lodge asked: "This barbarian yi country, grand master why solemnly condescend visit?" Zi Gong said: "Now I advised Wu wang save Lu attack Qi, his will desire it but fear Yue, said wait me attack Yue then can. Thus, break Yue certain. Moreover without avenge people will make people suspect it, clumsy; Have avenge people will make people know it, dangerous; Affair not issue first heard, perilous. Three manage affair great calamity." Gou Jian knocked head twice bowed: "Gu once not measure strength, with Wu battle, trapped at Kui Ji, pain entered bone marrow, day night scorched lips dry tongue, only wished with Wu wang connect heels die, gu wish." Then asked Zi Gong. Zi Gong said: "Wu wang fierce violent, ministers cannot bear; State depleted from frequent battles, soldiers cannot endure; People resent superiors, ministers internally change; Zi Xu died remonstrating, Grand Steward Pi governs, follows jun excesses to secure his private interests: this remnant country governance. Now wang sincerely send troops assist him realize his ambitions, heavy treasures to please his heart, humble words to honor his ritual, his attack Qi certain. They battle not victorious, wang blessing. Battle victorious, must with troops approach Jin, subject please north see Jin jun, make jointly attack it, weaken Wu certain. Its sharp troops exhausted at Qi, heavy armor trapped at Jin, wang control their depleted, this extinguish Wu certain." Yue wang greatly pleased, promised. Sent Zi Gong gold hundred yi, sword one, good spears two. Zi Gong not accepted, then departed.

sentences.zh: 報吳王曰：「臣敬以大王之言告越王，越王大恐，曰：『孤不幸，少失先人，內不自量，抵罪於吳，軍敗身辱，棲于會稽，國為虛莽，賴大王之賜，使得奉俎豆而修祭祀，死不敢忘，何謀之敢慮！』」

translations.literal: Reported Wu wang: "Subject respectfully with great wang words tell Yue wang, Yue wang greatly feared, said: Lonely unfortunate, young lost predecessors, internal not self-measure, offended Wu, army defeated body humiliated, dwelt at Kui Ji, country became empty wilderness, relied great wang grant, obtained maintain sacrificial vessels repair sacrifices, death dare not forget, what plotting dare consider!"
translations.idiomatic: He reported to the King of Wu: 'I respectfully conveyed your majesty's words to the King of Yue. The King of Yue was greatly terrified and said: "I was unfortunate, losing my ancestors when young. Internally I did not measure myself and offended Wu. My army was defeated and my body humiliated. I dwelt at Kuai Ji. My country became an empty wilderness. Relying on your majesty's grant, I obtained the sacrificial vessels to maintain sacrifices. In death I dare not forget. What plotting would I dare consider!"'

sentences.zh: 後五日，越使大夫種頓首言於吳王曰：「東海役臣孤句踐使者臣種，敢修下吏問於左右。

translations.literal: After five days, Yue sent grand master Zhong knocked head spoke to Wu wang: "East sea servant subject lonely Gou Jian envoy subject Zhong, dare as petty official inquire at your side.
translations.idiomatic: After five days, Yue sent Grand Master Zhong who knocked his head and spoke to the King of Wu: 'East Sea servant, the lonely Gou Jian's envoy, subject Zhong, dares as a petty official to inquire at your side.'

sentences.zh: 今竊聞大王將興大義，誅彊救弱，困暴齊而撫周室，請悉起境內士卒三千人，孤請自被堅執銳，以先受矢石。

translations.literal: Now secretly heard great wang will raise great righteousness, execute strong save weak, exhaust violent Qi pacify Zhou house, please arise all within borders soldiers three thousand, lonely please personally don armor grasp sharp weapons, to first receive arrows stones.
translations.idiomatic: 'Now I have secretly heard that your majesty will raise great righteousness, execute the strong and save the weak, exhaust the violent Qi and pacify the Zhou house. I request to raise all soldiers within my borders, three thousand men. I will personally don armor and grasp sharp weapons, to first receive the arrows and stones.'

sentences.zh: 因越賤臣種奉先人藏器，甲二十領，鈇屈盧之矛，步光之劍，以賀軍吏。」

translations.literal: Because Yue petty minister Zhong present predecessors hidden treasures, armor twenty suits, Fu Qu Lu axes, Bu Guang swords, to congratulate army officials."
translations.idiomatic: 'Because the petty minister of Yue, Zhong, presents his ancestors' hidden treasures: twenty suits of armor, Fu Qulu axes, Buguang swords, to congratulate the army officials.'

sentences.zh: 吳王大說，以告子貢曰：「越王欲身從寡人伐齊，可乎？」

translations.literal: Wu wang greatly pleased, told Zi Gong: "Yue wang wishes personally follow me attack Qi, can?"
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu was greatly pleased and told Zigong: 'The King of Yue wishes to personally follow me to attack Qi. Is this acceptable?'

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Cannot.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'It cannot be done.

sentences.zh: 夫空人之國，悉人之眾，又從其君，不義。

translations.literal: Empty person country, take all person multitude, moreover follow their jun, not righteous.
translations.idiomatic: To empty another's country and take all their multitude, and moreover follow their ruler, is not righteous.'

sentences.zh: 君受其幣，許其師，而辭其君。」

translations.literal: Jun accept their currency, permit their troops, decline their jun."
translations.idiomatic: My lord should accept their tribute, permit their troops, but decline their ruler.'

translations.literal: Wu wang agreed, then declined Yue wang.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu agreed and then declined the King of Yue.

sentences.zh: 於是吳王乃遂發九郡兵伐齊。

translations.literal: Then Wu wang then mobilized nine commanderies troops attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the King of Wu mobilized the troops of nine commanderies to attack Qi.

translations.literal: Reported Wu wang: "Subject respectfully with great wang words tell Yue wang, Yue wang greatly feared, said: Lonely unfortunate, young lost predecessors, internal not self-measure, offended Wu, army defeated body humiliated, dwelt at Kui Ji, country became empty wilderness, relied great wang grant, obtained maintain sacrificial vessels repair sacrifices, death dare not forget, what plotting dare consider!" After five days, Yue sent grand master Zhong knocked head spoke to Wu wang: "East sea servant subject lonely Gou Jian envoy subject Zhong, dare as petty official inquire at your side. Now secretly heard great wang will raise great righteousness, execute strong save weak, exhaust violent Qi pacify Zhou house, please arise all within borders soldiers three thousand, lonely please personally don armor grasp sharp weapons, to first receive arrows stones. Because Yue petty minister Zhong present predecessors hidden treasures, armor twenty suits, Fu Qu Lu axes, Bu Guang swords, to congratulate army officials." Wu wang greatly pleased, told Zi Gong: "Yue wang wishes personally follow me attack Qi, can?" Zi Gong said: "Cannot. Empty person country, take all person multitude, moreover follow their jun, not righteous. Jun accept their currency, permit their troops, decline their jun." Wu wang agreed, then declined Yue wang. Then Wu wang then mobilized nine commanderies troops attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 子貢因去之晉，謂晉君曰：「臣聞之，慮不先定不可以應卒，兵不先辨不可以勝敵。

translations.literal: Zi Gong because went to Jin, told Jin jun: "Subject heard, plans not first decided cannot respond to emergencies, troops not first prepared cannot defeat enemy.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong then went to Jin and told the Jin ruler: 'I have heard that plans not decided beforehand cannot respond to emergencies, troops not prepared beforehand cannot defeat enemies.

sentences.zh: 今夫齊與吳將戰，彼戰而不勝，越亂之必矣；

translations.literal: Now Qi with Wu will battle, they battle not victorious, Yue will chaos them certain;
translations.idiomatic: Now Qi and Wu will battle. If they battle and Wu is not victorious, Yue will certainly disrupt them;'

sentences.zh: 與齊戰而勝，必以其兵臨晉。」

translations.literal: With Qi battle victorious, must with troops approach Jin."
translations.idiomatic: 'if Wu battles with Qi and wins, they will certainly approach Jin with troops.'

translations.literal: Jin jun greatly feared: "Do what?"
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ruler was greatly terrified and said: 'What should be done?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「修兵休卒以待之。」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Repair troops rest soldiers await them."
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'Repair your troops and rest your soldiers to await them.'

translations.literal: Jin jun agreed.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ruler agreed.

translations.literal: Zi Gong because went to Jin, told Jin jun: "Subject heard, plans not first decided cannot respond to emergencies, troops not first prepared cannot defeat enemy. Now Qi with Wu will battle, they battle not victorious, Yue will chaos them certain; With Qi battle victorious, must with troops approach Jin." Jin jun greatly feared: "Do what?" Zi Gong said: "Repair troops rest soldiers await them." Jin jun agreed.
Zi Gong departed went to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong departed and went to Lu.

sentences.zh: 吳王果與齊人戰於艾陵，大破齊師，獲七將軍之兵而不歸，果以兵臨晉，與晉人相遇黃池之上。

translations.literal: Wu wang indeed with Qi people battled at Ai Ling, greatly defeated Qi troops, obtained seven generals troops not return, indeed with troops approached Jin, with Jin people met at Huang Chi above.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed the King of Wu battled with the Qi people at Ailing, greatly defeated the Qi troops, obtained the troops of seven generals but did not return, indeed approached Jin with troops, and met the Jin people above Huangchi.

translations.literal: Wu Jin contended strong.
translations.idiomatic: Wu and Jin contended for strength.

translations.literal: Jin people attacked them, greatly defeated Wu troops.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people attacked them and greatly defeated the Wu troops.

sentences.zh: 越王聞之，涉江襲吳，去城七里而軍。

translations.literal: Yue wang heard it, crossed Jiang attacked Wu, seven li from city camped.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue heard this and crossed the Jiang to attack Wu, camping seven li from the city.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之，去晉而歸，與越戰於五湖。

translations.literal: Wu wang heard it, left Jin returned, with Yue battled at Five Lakes.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu heard this, left Jin and returned, battling with Yue at the Five Lakes.

sentences.zh: 三戰不勝，城門不守，越遂圍王宮，殺夫差而戮其相。

translations.literal: Three battles not victorious, city gates not defended, Yue then surrounded wang palace, killed Fu Chai executed his minister.
translations.idiomatic: After three battles without victory and the city gates undefended, Yue surrounded the royal palace, killed Fuchai, and executed his minister.

translations.literal: Broke Wu three years, east facing became hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: Three years after breaking Wu, facing east he became hegemon.

translations.literal: Zi Gong departed went to Lu. Wu wang indeed with Qi people battled at Ai Ling, greatly defeated Qi troops, obtained seven generals troops not return, indeed with troops approached Jin, with Jin people met at Huang Chi above. Wu Jin contended strong. Jin people attacked them, greatly defeated Wu troops. Yue wang heard it, crossed Jiang attacked Wu, seven li from city camped. Wu wang heard it, left Jin returned, with Yue battled at Five Lakes. Three battles not victorious, city gates not defended, Yue then surrounded wang palace, killed Fu Chai executed his minister. Broke Wu three years, east facing became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 故子貢一出，存魯，亂齊，破吳，彊晉而霸越。

translations.literal: Therefore Zi Gong one departure, preserved Lu, disordered Qi, broke Wu, strengthened Jin hegemonized Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore with Zigong's one departure, he preserved Lu, disordered Qi, broke Wu, strengthened Jin, and made Yue hegemon.

sentences.zh: 子貢一使，使勢相破，十年之中，五國各有變。

translations.literal: Zi Gong one mission, made powers mutually break, ten years midst, five states each had change.
translations.idiomatic: With Zigong's one mission, he made the powers break each other. Within ten years, the five states each underwent change.

translations.literal: Therefore Zi Gong one departure, preserved Lu, disordered Qi, broke Wu, strengthened Jin hegemonized Yue. Zi Gong one mission, made powers mutually break, ten years midst, five states each had change.

sentences.zh: 子貢好廢舉，與時轉貨貲。

translations.literal: Zi Gong liked dismissing raising, with times circulated wealth.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong liked dismissing and promoting officials, and circulated wealth according to the times.

sentences.zh: 喜揚人之美，不能匿人之過。

translations.literal: Delighted extol people beauty, could not conceal people faults.
translations.idiomatic: He delighted in extolling people's virtues and could not conceal their faults.

sentences.zh: 常相魯衛，家累千金，卒終于齊。

translations.literal: Often assisted Lu Wei, home accumulated thousand jin, finally ended in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He often assisted Lu and Wei. His family accumulated a thousand jin. He finally died in Qi.

translations.literal: Zi Gong liked dismissing raising, with times circulated wealth. Delighted extol people beauty, could not conceal people faults. Often assisted Lu Wei, home accumulated thousand jin, finally ended in Qi.
Yan Yan, Wu man, styled Zi You.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yan was a man from Wu, whose courtesy name was Ziyou.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by forty-five years.
translations.idiomatic: He was forty-five years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Yan Yan, Wu man, styled Zi You. Younger than Confucius by forty-five years.

sentences.zh: 子游既已受業，為武城宰。

translations.literal: Zi You having received teachings, became Wu Cheng magistrate.
translations.idiomatic: After Ziyou had received his teachings, he became magistrate of Wucheng.

translations.literal: Confucius passed by, heard string song sounds.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius passed by and heard the sounds of string and song.

sentences.zh: 孔子莞爾而笑曰：「割雞焉用牛刀？」

translations.literal: Confucius smiled: "Cut chicken why use ox knife?"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius smiled and said: 'Why use an ox-cleaver to cut a chicken?'

sentences.zh: 子游曰：「昔者偃聞諸夫子曰，君子學道則愛人，小人學道則易使。」

translations.literal: Zi You said: "Formerly Yan heard from Master: Gentleman learns Way then loves people, petty man learns Way then easy employ."
translations.idiomatic: Ziyou said: 'Formerly Yan heard from the Master: When a gentleman learns the Way, he loves people; when a petty man learns the Way, he becomes easy to employ.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「二三子，偃之言是也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "You several, Yan words correct.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'You disciples, Yan's words are correct.

translations.literal: Previous words joking."
translations.idiomatic: My previous words were just in jest.'

sentences.zh: 孔子以為子游習於文學。

translations.literal: Confucius considered Zi You practiced in scholarship.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered Ziyou practiced in literature.

translations.literal: Zi You having received teachings, became Wu Cheng magistrate. Confucius passed by, heard string song sounds. Confucius smiled: "Cut chicken why use ox knife?" Zi You said: "Formerly Yan heard from Master: Gentleman learns Way then loves people, petty man learns Way then easy employ." Confucius said: "You several, Yan words correct. Previous words joking." Confucius considered Zi You practiced in scholarship.
Bu Shang styled Zi Xia.
translations.idiomatic: Bu Shang, whose courtesy name was Zixia.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by forty-four years.
translations.idiomatic: He was forty-four years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Bu Shang styled Zi Xia. Younger than Confucius by forty-four years.

sentences.zh: 子夏問：「『巧笑倩兮，美目盼兮，素以為絢兮』，何謂也？」

translations.literal: Zi Xia asked: "Graceful smile dimples, beautiful eyes gazing, plain silk as ornament, what means?"
translations.idiomatic: Zixia asked: 'What does "Graceful smiles dimpling, beautiful eyes gazing, plain silk as ornament" mean?'

translations.literal: Master said: "Painting follows plain."
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Painting follows the plain base.'

translations.literal: Said: "Ritual after?"
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Does ritual come after?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「商始可與言詩已矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Shang now can discuss poetry."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Shang can now discuss poetry.'

translations.literal: Zi Xia asked: "Graceful smile dimples, beautiful eyes gazing, plain silk as ornament, what means?" Master said: "Painting follows plain." Said: "Ritual after?" Confucius said: "Shang now can discuss poetry."
Zi Gong asked: "Shi and Shang which worthy?"
translations.idiomatic: Zigong asked: 'Which is more worthy, Shi or Shang?'

translations.literal: Master said: "Shi exceeds, Shang not reaches."
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Shi exceeds, Shang does not reach.'

translations.literal: "Then Shi better?"
translations.idiomatic: 'Then is Shi better?'

translations.literal: Said: "Exceed same as not reach."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Exceeding is the same as not reaching.'

translations.literal: Zi Gong asked: "Shi and Shang which worthy?" Master said: "Shi exceeds, Shang not reaches." "Then Shi better?" Said: "Exceed same as not reach."

sentences.zh: 子謂子夏曰：「汝為君子儒，無為小人儒。」

translations.literal: Master told Zi Xia: "You be gentleman ru, not be petty man ru."
translations.idiomatic: The Master told Zixia: 'Be a gentleman ru, do not be a petty man ru.'

translations.literal: Master told Zi Xia: "You be gentleman ru, not be petty man ru."

sentences.zh: 孔子既沒，子夏居西河教授，為魏文侯師。

translations.literal: Confucius having passed, Zi Xia dwelt Xi River teaching, became Wei Wen Hou teacher.
translations.idiomatic: After Confucius passed away, Zixia dwelt by the Xi River and taught, becoming the teacher of Duke Wen of Wei.

translations.literal: His son died, cried lost sight.
translations.idiomatic: His son died, and he cried until he lost his sight.

translations.literal: Confucius having passed, Zi Xia dwelt Xi River teaching, became Wei Wen Hou teacher. His son died, cried lost sight.
Zhuan Sun Shi, Chen man, styled Zi Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuansun Shi was a man from Chen, whose courtesy name was Zizhang.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by forty-eight years.
translations.idiomatic: He was forty-eight years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Zhuan Sun Shi, Chen man, styled Zi Zhang. Younger than Confucius by forty-eight years.

sentences.zh: 子張問干祿，孔子曰：「多聞闕疑，慎言其餘，則寡尤；

translations.literal: Zi Zhang asked seek office, Confucius said: "Much hear leave doubts, careful speak remainder, then few faults;
translations.idiomatic: Zizhang asked about seeking office. Confucius said: 'Hear much and leave doubts, speak carefully about the rest, then you will have few faults;'

sentences.zh: 多見闕殆，慎行其餘，則寡悔。

translations.literal: Much see leave peril, careful act remainder, then few regrets.
translations.idiomatic: 'see much and leave perils, act carefully about the rest, then you will have few regrets.'

sentences.zh: 言寡尤，行寡悔，祿在其中矣。」

translations.literal: Speak few faults, act few regrets, office in midst."
translations.idiomatic: 'Speak with few faults, act with few regrets, and office will be in your midst.'

translations.literal: Zi Zhang asked seek office, Confucius said: "Much hear leave doubts, careful speak remainder, then few faults; Much see leave peril, careful act remainder, then few regrets. Speak few faults, act few regrets, office in midst."

sentences.zh: 他日從在陳蔡閒，困，問行。

translations.literal: Another day followed in Chen Cai midst, distressed, asked conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Another day while following between Chen and Cai, distressed, he asked about conduct.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「言忠信，行篤敬，雖蠻貊之國行也；

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Speak loyal faithful, act solid respectful, though barbarian yi countries go;
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Speak with loyalty and faithfulness, act with solid respectfulness, and you can go even to barbarian Man and Mo countries;'

sentences.zh: 言不忠信，行不篤敬，雖州裏行乎哉！

translations.literal: Speak not loyal faithful, act not solid respectful, though state li go?
translations.idiomatic: 'speak without loyalty and faithfulness, act without solid respectfulness, and though it be your own state and neighborhood, can you go?'

sentences.zh: 立則見其參於前也，在輿則見其倚於衡，夫然後行。」

translations.literal: Stand then see it stand before, in carriage then see it lean on yoke, only then go."
translations.idiomatic: 'When standing, see it standing before you; when in a carriage, see it leaning on the yoke. Only then may you go.'

translations.literal: Zi Zhang wrote on sash.
translations.idiomatic: Zizhang wrote it on his sash.

translations.literal: Another day followed in Chen Cai midst, distressed, asked conduct. Confucius said: "Speak loyal faithful, act solid respectful, though barbarian yi countries go; Speak not loyal faithful, act not solid respectful, though state li go? Stand then see it stand before, in carriage then see it lean on yoke, only then go." Zi Zhang wrote on sash.

sentences.zh: 子張問：「士何如斯可謂之達矣？」
