translations.literal: Zi Zhang asked: "Scholar what like can call attained?"
translations.idiomatic: Zizhang asked: 'What must a scholar be like to be called attained?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「何哉，爾所謂達者？」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "What, you called attained?"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'What do you mean by attained?'

sentences.zh: 子張對曰：「在國必聞，在家必聞。」

translations.literal: Zi Zhang replied: "In state must famous, in home must famous."
translations.idiomatic: Zizhang replied: 'In the state he must be famous, in the home he must be famous.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "This famous, not attained.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'This is fame, not attainment.

sentences.zh: 夫達者，質直而好義，察言而觀色，慮以下人，在國及家必達。

translations.literal: Attained, substance straight loves righteousness, examines words observes color, considers yields to people, in state home must attained.
translations.idiomatic: The attained are straightforward in substance and love righteousness. They examine words and observe expressions. They consider yielding to others. In state and home they must be attained.'

sentences.zh: 夫聞也者，色取仁而行違，居之不疑，在國及家必聞。」

translations.literal: Famous, appearance takes benevolence but conduct violates, dwells not doubt, in state home must famous."
translations.idiomatic: The famous take benevolence in appearance but violate it in conduct. They dwell in it without doubt. In state and home they must be famous.'

translations.literal: Zi Zhang asked: "Scholar what like can call attained?" Confucius said: "What, you called attained?" Zi Zhang replied: "In state must famous, in home must famous." Confucius said: "This famous, not attained. Attained, substance straight loves righteousness, examines words observes color, considers yields to people, in state home must attained. Famous, appearance takes benevolence but conduct violates, dwells not doubt, in state home must famous."
Zeng Shen, Nan Wu Cheng man, styled Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Zeng Shen was a man from Nan Wucheng, whose courtesy name was Ziyu.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by forty-six years.
translations.idiomatic: He was forty-six years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Zeng Shen, Nan Wu Cheng man, styled Zi Yu. Younger than Confucius by forty-six years.

sentences.zh: 孔子以為能通孝道，故授之業。

translations.literal: Confucius considered able penetrate filial way, therefore taught teachings.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered him able to penetrate the way of filial piety, therefore he taught him his teachings.

translations.literal: Composed Filial Classic.
translations.idiomatic: He composed the Classic of Filial Piety.

translations.literal: Died in Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He died in Lu.

translations.literal: Confucius considered able penetrate filial way, therefore taught teachings. Composed Filial Classic. Died in Lu.

sentences.zh: 澹臺滅明，武城人，字子羽。

translations.literal: Dan Tai Mie Ming, Wu Cheng man, styled Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Dantai Mieming was a man from Wucheng, whose courtesy name was Ziyou.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty-nine years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty-nine years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Dan Tai Mie Ming, Wu Cheng man, styled Zi Yu. Younger than Confucius by thirty-nine years.
Appearance very ugly.
translations.idiomatic: His appearance was very ugly.

sentences.zh: 欲事孔子，孔子以為材薄。

translations.literal: Wished serve Confucius, Confucius considered talent thin.
translations.idiomatic: He wished to serve Confucius, but Confucius considered his talent thin.

sentences.zh: 既已受業，退而修行，行不由徑，非公事不見卿大夫。

translations.literal: Having received teachings, withdrew practiced conduct, conduct not by paths, not public affairs not see grand masters.
translations.idiomatic: Having received his teachings, he withdrew and practiced conduct. His conduct did not take shortcuts. He did not see grand masters except for public affairs.

translations.literal: Appearance very ugly. Wished serve Confucius, Confucius considered talent thin. Having received teachings, withdrew practiced conduct, conduct not by paths, not public affairs not see grand masters.

sentences.zh: 南游至江，從弟子三百人，設取予去就，名施乎諸侯。

translations.literal: South toured to Jiang, followers three hundred people, established take give depart remain, name extended to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He toured south to the Jiang with three hundred followers. He established principles of taking and giving, departing and remaining. His name extended to the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞之，曰：「吾以言取人，失之宰予；

translations.literal: Confucius heard, said: "I with words take people, lost Zai Yu;
translations.idiomatic: Confucius heard this and said: 'I take people by their words and lost Zai Yu;'

translations.literal: With appearance take people, lost Zi Yu."
translations.idiomatic: 'I take people by their appearance and lost Ziyou.'

translations.literal: South toured to Jiang, followers three hundred people, established take give depart remain, name extended to feudal lords. Confucius heard, said: "I with words take people, lost Zai Yu; With appearance take people, lost Zi Yu."
Mi Bu Qi styled Zi Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Mi Buqi, whose courtesy name was Zijian.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Mi Bu Qi styled Zi Jian. Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
Confucius told Zi Jian, "Gentleman!
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said to Zijian, 'What a gentleman!

translations.literal: Lu no gentleman, where take this?"
translations.idiomatic: If there were no gentlemen in Lu, where did this one come from?'

translations.literal: Confucius told Zi Jian, "Gentleman! Lu no gentleman, where take this?"

sentences.zh: 子賤為單父宰，反命於孔子，曰：「此國有賢不齊者五人，教不齊所以治者。」

translations.literal: Zi Jian became Shan Fu magistrate, reported back to Confucius: "This state has five people whose talents not equal, teach not equal so govern."
translations.idiomatic: Zijian became magistrate of Shanfu and reported back to Confucius: 'This state has five people whose talents are unmatched. I teach them to govern by not being overly controlling.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「惜哉不齊所治者小，所治者大則庶幾矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Pity Jian governed small, governed great then almost."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'What a pity! Buqi governs only a small area. If he governed a large one, he would nearly achieve perfection.'

translations.literal: Zi Jian became Shan Fu magistrate, reported back to Confucius: "This state has five people whose talents not equal, teach not equal so govern." Confucius said: "Pity Jian governed small, governed great then almost."
Yuan Xian styled Zi Si.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Xian, whose courtesy name was Zisi.

translations.literal: Yuan Xian styled Zi Si.
Zi Si asked shame.
translations.idiomatic: Zisi asked about shame.

translations.literal: Confucius said: "State has Way, salary.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'When the state follows the Way, then salary

translations.literal: State no Way, salary, shame."
translations.idiomatic: when the state does not follow the Way, then salary is shameful.'

translations.literal: Zi Si asked shame. Confucius said: "State has Way, salary. State no Way, salary, shame."

sentences.zh: 子思曰：「克、伐、怨、欲不行焉，可以為仁乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Si said: "Conquer, boast, resent, desire not practice, can be benevolence?"
translations.idiomatic: Zisi said: 'If one does not practice conquest, boasting, resentment, or desire, can this be called benevolence?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「可以為難矣，仁則吾弗知也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Can be difficult, benevolence then I not know."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'That can be called difficult. But as for benevolence, I do not know.'

translations.literal: Zi Si said: "Conquer, boast, resent, desire not practice, can be benevolence?" Confucius said: "Can be difficult, benevolence then I not know."

sentences.zh: 孔子卒，原憲遂亡在草澤中。

translations.literal: Confucius died, Yuan Xian then hid in grass marshes.
translations.idiomatic: After Confucius died, Yuanxian went into hiding among the reeds and marshes.

sentences.zh: 子貢相衛，而結駟連騎，排藜藿入窮閻，過謝原憲。

translations.literal: Zi Gong assisted Wei, connected chariots four horses, pushed thorn gate entered poor lanes, passed thanked Yuan Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong served as prime minister of Wei, riding in a carriage drawn by four horses followed by outriders. He pushed aside the thorn gate and entered the poor alley to visit and thank Yuanxian.

translations.literal: Xian adjusted ragged clothes cap saw Zi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xian adjusted his tattered clothes and cap before seeing Zigong.

sentences.zh: 子貢恥之，曰：「夫子豈病乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong ashamed, said: "Master perhaps ill?"
translations.idiomatic: Zigong felt ashamed and said: 'Master, are you perhaps ill?'

sentences.zh: 原憲曰：「吾聞之，無財者謂之貧，學道而不能行者謂之病。

translations.literal: Yuan Xian said: "I heard, no wealth called poor, learn Way cannot practice called ill.
translations.idiomatic: Yuanxian said: 'I have heard that one without wealth is called poor, but one who learns the Way yet cannot practice it is called ill.

translations.literal: Like Xian, poor, not ill."
translations.idiomatic: As for me, Xian, I am poor, but not ill.'

sentences.zh: 子貢慚，不懌而去，終身恥其言之過也。

translations.literal: Zi Gong ashamed, displeased departed, lifetime ashamed his words excess.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong felt ashamed, left displeased, and was ashamed of his excessive words for the rest of his life.

translations.literal: Confucius died, Yuan Xian then hid in grass marshes. Zi Gong assisted Wei, connected chariots four horses, pushed thorn gate entered poor lanes, passed thanked Yuan Xian. Xian adjusted ragged clothes cap saw Zi Gong. Zi Gong ashamed, said: "Master perhaps ill?" Yuan Xian said: "I heard, no wealth called poor, learn Way cannot practice called ill. Like Xian, poor, not ill." Zi Gong ashamed, displeased departed, lifetime ashamed his words excess.
Gong Ye Chang, Qi man, styled Zi Chang.
translations.idiomatic: Gongye Chang was a man from Qi, whose courtesy name was Zichang.

translations.literal: Gong Ye Chang, Qi man, styled Zi Chang.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「長可妻也，雖在累紲之中，非其罪也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Chang can marry, though in fetters, not his crime."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Chang can be married off. Though he is in fetters, it is not his crime.'

translations.literal: Gave his daughter married him.
translations.idiomatic: He gave his daughter in marriage to him.

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Chang can marry, though in fetters, not his crime." Gave his daughter married him.
Nan Gong Kuo styled Zi Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Nangong Kuo, whose courtesy name was Zirong.

translations.literal: Nan Gong Kuo styled Zi Rong.

sentences.zh: 問孔子曰：「羿善射，奡盪舟，俱不得其死然；

translations.literal: Asked Confucius: "Yi good shooting, Ao capsized boat, both not obtain proper death;
translations.idiomatic: He asked Confucius: 'Yi was skilled at archery, Ao capsized the boat - both met untimely deaths;

translations.literal: Yu Ji personally farmed obtained world?"
translations.idiomatic: Yu and Ji personally farmed and obtained the world?'

translations.literal: Confucius not answered.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius did not answer.

sentences.zh: 容出，孔子曰：「君子哉若人！

translations.literal: Rong left, Confucius said: "Gentleman such person!
translations.idiomatic: After Rong left, Confucius said: 'What a gentleman that person is!

translations.literal: Superior virtue such person!"
translations.idiomatic: What superior virtue that person has!'

translations.literal: "State has Way, not discarded;
translations.idiomatic: 'When the state follows the Way, he is not discarded;

translations.literal: State no Way, avoid punishment execution."
translations.idiomatic: when the state does not follow the Way, he avoids punishment and execution.'

sentences.zh: 三復「白珪之玷」，以其兄之子妻之。

translations.literal: Three times repeated "White jade flaw", gave his brother son married him.
translations.idiomatic: He recited the 'White Jade Flaw' three times and gave his brother's daughter in marriage to him.

translations.literal: Asked Confucius: "Yi good shooting, Ao capsized boat, both not obtain proper death; Yu Ji personally farmed obtained world?" Confucius not answered. Rong left, Confucius said: "Gentleman such person! Superior virtue such person!" "State has Way, not discarded; State no Way, avoid punishment execution." Three times repeated "White jade flaw", gave his brother son married him.
Gong Xi Ai styled Ji Ci.
translations.idiomatic: Gongxi Ai, whose courtesy name was Jici.

translations.literal: Gong Xi Ai styled Ji Ci.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「天下無行，多為家臣，仕於都；

translations.literal: Confucius said: "World no conduct, many become family ministers, serve in capitals;
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'The world lacks proper conduct. Many become retainers in noble houses and serve in the capitals;

translations.literal: Only Ji Ci never served."
translations.idiomatic: only Jici has never held office.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "World no conduct, many become family ministers, serve in capitals; Only Ji Ci never served."
Zeng Dian styled Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Zeng Dian, whose courtesy name was Xi.

translations.literal: Attended Confucius, Confucius said: "Speak your ambition."
translations.idiomatic: He attended Confucius. Confucius said: 'Speak of your ambitions.'

sentences.zh: 蒧曰：「春服既成，冠者五六人，童子六七人，浴乎沂，風乎舞雩，詠而歸。」

translations.literal: Dian said: "Spring clothes completed, youths five six people, children six seven people, bathe Yi river, dance rain dance, chant return."
translations.idiomatic: Dian said: 'When spring clothes are finished, with five or six youths and six or seven boys, we bathe in the Yi River, enjoy the breeze at the Rain Dance Altar, and return singing.'

sentences.zh: 孔子喟爾嘆曰：「吾與蒧也！」

translations.literal: Confucius sighed: "I with Dian!"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius sighed deeply and said: 'I am with Dian!'

translations.literal: Zeng Dian styled Xi. Attended Confucius, Confucius said: "Speak your ambition." Dian said: "Spring clothes completed, youths five six people, children six seven people, bathe Yi river, dance rain dance, chant return." Confucius sighed: "I with Dian!"
Yan Wu You styled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Wuyou, whose courtesy name was Lu.

sentences.zh: 路者，顏回父，父子嘗各異時事孔子。

translations.literal: Lu, Yan Hui father, father son once each different times served Confucius.
translations.idiomatic: Lu was Yan Hui's father. Father and son each served Confucius at different times.

translations.literal: Yan Wu You styled Lu. Lu, Yan Hui father, father son once each different times served Confucius.

sentences.zh: 顏回死，顏路貧，請孔子車以葬。

translations.literal: Yan Hui died, Yan Lu poor, requested Confucius carriage bury.
translations.idiomatic: When Yan Hui died, Yan Lu was poor and requested Confucius's carriage for the burial.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「材不材，亦各言其子也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Able not able, also each speak their son.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Whether able or not able, each person speaks of their own son.

sentences.zh: 鯉也死，有棺而無槨，吾不徒行以為之槨，以吾從大夫之後，不可以徒行。」

translations.literal: Li died, had coffin no outer coffin, I not go on foot make outer coffin, because I follow grand master after, cannot go on foot."
translations.idiomatic: When Li died, he had a coffin but no outer coffin. I would not walk on foot to provide an outer coffin, because I follow after grand masters and cannot walk on foot.'

translations.literal: Yan Hui died, Yan Lu poor, requested Confucius carriage bury. Confucius said: "Able not able, also each speak their son. Li died, had coffin no outer coffin, I not go on foot make outer coffin, because I follow grand master after, cannot go on foot."
Shang Qu, Lu man, styled Zi Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Shang Qu was a man from Lu, whose courtesy name was Zimu.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years.
translations.idiomatic: He was twenty-nine years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Shang Qu, Lu man, styled Zi Mu. Younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years.

sentences.zh: 孔子傳易於瞿，瞿傳楚人馯臂子弘，弘傳江東人矯子庸疵，疵傳燕人周子家豎，豎傳淳于人光子乘羽，羽傳齊人田子莊何，何傳東武人王子中同，同傳菑川人楊何。

translations.literal: Confucius transmitted Changes to Qu, Qu transmitted Chu man Chan Bi Zi Hong, Hong transmitted Jiang Dong man Jiao Zi Yong Ci, Ci transmitted Yan man Zhou Zi Jia Shu, Shu transmitted Chun Yu man Guang Zi Cheng Yu, Yu transmitted Qi man Tian Zi Zhuang He, He transmitted Dong Wu man Wang Zi Zhong Tong, Tong transmitted Zi Chuan man Yang He.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius transmitted the Changes to Qu, Qu transmitted it to the Chu man Chanbi Zihong, Hong transmitted it to the Jiangdong man Jiao Ziyongci, Ci transmitted it to the Yan man Zhou Zijia Shu, Shu transmitted it to the Chunyu man Guang Zi Chengyu, Yu transmitted it to the Qi man Tian Zizhuang He, He transmitted it to the Dongwu man Wang Zizhong Tong, Tong transmitted it to the Zichuan man Yang He.

sentences.zh: 何元朔中以治易為漢中大夫。

translations.literal: He in Yuan Shuo midst with treating Changes became Han Zhong grand master.
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the Yuanshuo era, He became the Zhongdafu of Han for his mastery of the Changes.

translations.literal: Confucius transmitted Changes to Qu, Qu transmitted Chu man Chan Bi Zi Hong, Hong transmitted Jiang Dong man Jiao Zi Yong Ci, Ci transmitted Yan man Zhou Zi Jia Shu, Shu transmitted Chun Yu man Guang Zi Cheng Yu, Yu transmitted Qi man Tian Zi Zhuang He, He transmitted Dong Wu man Wang Zi Zhong Tong, Tong transmitted Zi Chuan man Yang He. He in Yuan Shuo midst with treating Changes became Han Zhong grand master.
Gao Chai styled Zi Gao.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Chai, whose courtesy name was Zigao.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Gao Chai styled Zi Gao. Younger than Confucius by thirty years.

sentences.zh: 子羔長不盈五尺，受業孔子，孔子以為愚。

translations.literal: Zi Gao height not exceed five chi, received teachings Confucius, Confucius considered foolish.
translations.idiomatic: Zigao was not even five chi tall. He studied under Confucius, who considered him foolish.

translations.literal: Zi Gao height not exceed five chi, received teachings Confucius, Confucius considered foolish.

sentences.zh: 子路使子羔為費郈宰，孔子曰：「賊夫人之子！」

translations.literal: Zi Lu made Zi Gao Fei Hou magistrate, Confucius said: "Will harm such person son!"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu appointed Zigao as magistrate of Feihou. Confucius said: 'This will harm such a person's son!'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「有民人焉，有社稷焉，何必讀書然後為學！」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: "Has people, has altars soil, why must read books then study!"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'There are people and there are altars of soil and grain. Why must one read books before one can be considered learned?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Therefore hate glib speakers."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'This is why I hate glib speakers.'

translations.literal: Zi Lu made Zi Gao Fei Hou magistrate, Confucius said: "Will harm such person son!" Zi Lu said: "Has people, has altars soil, why must read books then study!" Confucius said: "Therefore hate glib speakers."
Qi Diao Kai styled Zi Kai.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Diao Kai, whose courtesy name was Zikai.

translations.literal: Qi Diao Kai styled Zi Kai.

sentences.zh: 孔子使開仕，對曰：「吾斯之未能信。」

translations.literal: Confucius made Kai serve office, replied: "I this not yet believe."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius urged Kai to take office. He replied: 'I am not yet confident in this.'

translations.literal: Confucius pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius was pleased.

translations.literal: Confucius made Kai serve office, replied: "I this not yet believe." Confucius pleased.
Gong Bo Liao styled Zi Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo Liao, whose courtesy name was Zizhou.

translations.literal: Gong Bo Liao styled Zi Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周訴子路於季孫，子服景伯以告孔子，曰：「夫子固有惑志，繚也，吾力猶能肆諸市朝。」

translations.literal: Zhou accused Zi Lu to Ji Sun, Zi Fu Jing Bo told Confucius: "Master indeed has confused will, Liao, my strength still can expose at market court."
translations.idiomatic: Zhou slandered Zilu to Jisun. Zifu Jingbo informed Confucius, saying: 'Master indeed has confused intentions. As for Liao, my strength can still expose him in the marketplace and court.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Way will advance, fate;
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Whether the Way will advance or not is fate;

translations.literal: Way will decline, fate.
translations.idiomatic: whether the Way will decline or not is fate.

translations.literal: Gong Bo Liao how against fate!"
translations.idiomatic: What can Gong Bo Liao do against fate!'

translations.literal: Zhou accused Zi Lu to Ji Sun, Zi Fu Jing Bo told Confucius: "Master indeed has confused will, Liao, my strength still can expose at market court." Confucius said: "Way will advance, fate; Way will decline, fate. Gong Bo Liao how against fate!"
Si Ma Geng styled Zi Niu.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Geng, whose courtesy name was Ziniu.

translations.literal: Si Ma Geng styled Zi Niu.
Niu much talk hasty.
translations.idiomatic: Niu talked a lot and was hasty.

sentences.zh: 問仁於孔子，孔子曰：「仁者其言也讱。」

translations.literal: Asked benevolence Confucius, Confucius said: "Benevolent his words rare."
translations.idiomatic: He asked Confucius about benevolence. Confucius said: 'The benevolent person is sparing with his words.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「其言也讱，斯可謂之仁乎？」

translations.literal: Said: "His words rare, can call benevolence?"
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If his words are sparing, can this be called benevolence?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「為之難，言之得無讱乎！」

translations.literal: Master said: "Do difficult, speak obtain not rare!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'To do it is difficult. How could speaking not be sparing!'

translations.literal: Niu much talk hasty. Asked benevolence Confucius, Confucius said: "Benevolent his words rare." Said: "His words rare, can call benevolence?" Master said: "Do difficult, speak obtain not rare!"

sentences.zh: 問君子，子曰：「君子不憂不懼。」

translations.literal: Asked gentleman, Master said: "Gentleman not worry not fear."
translations.idiomatic: He asked about the gentleman. The Master said: 'The gentleman does not worry or fear.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「不憂不懼，斯可謂之君子乎？」

translations.literal: Said: "Not worry not fear, can call gentleman?"
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If one does not worry or fear, can this be called a gentleman?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「內省不疚，夫何憂何懼！」

translations.literal: Master said: "Internal examine not guilty, what worry what fear!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'If upon internal examination one finds no guilt, what is there to worry about or fear!'

translations.literal: Asked gentleman, Master said: "Gentleman not worry not fear." Said: "Not worry not fear, can call gentleman?" Master said: "Internal examine not guilty, what worry what fear!"
Fan Xu styled Zi Chi.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Xu, whose courtesy name was Zichi.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty-six years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty-six years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Fan Xu styled Zi Chi. Younger than Confucius by thirty-six years.

sentences.zh: 樊遲請學稼，孔子曰：「吾不如老農。」

translations.literal: Fan Chi requested learn farming, Confucius said: "I not as old farmer."
translations.idiomatic: Fanchi requested to learn farming. Confucius said: 'I am not as good as an old farmer.'

translations.literal: Requested learn gardening, said: "I not as old gardener."
translations.idiomatic: He requested to learn gardening. Confucius said: 'I am not as good as an old gardener.'

sentences.zh: 樊遲出，孔子曰：「小人哉樊須也！

translations.literal: Fan Chi left, Confucius said: "Petty man Fan Xu!
translations.idiomatic: When Fanchi left, Confucius said: 'What a petty man Fanxu is!

translations.literal: Superior good ritual, people dare not not respect;
translations.idiomatic: If the superior values ritual, then the people will dare not fail to respect;

translations.literal: Superior good righteousness, people dare not not submit;
translations.idiomatic: if the superior values righteousness, then the people will dare not fail to submit;

sentences.zh: 上好信，則民莫敢不用情。

translations.literal: Superior good faithfulness, people dare not not use sincerity.
translations.idiomatic: if the superior values faithfulness, then the people will dare not fail to use sincerity.

sentences.zh: 夫如是，則四方之民襁負其子而至矣，焉用稼！」

translations.literal: Like this, four directions people carry children come, where use farming!"
translations.idiomatic: If it is like this, then people from the four directions will carry their children on their backs and come. What use is farming!'

translations.literal: Fan Chi requested learn farming, Confucius said: "I not as old farmer." Requested learn gardening, said: "I not as old gardener." Fan Chi left, Confucius said: "Petty man Fan Xu! Superior good ritual, people dare not not respect; Superior good righteousness, people dare not not submit; Superior good faithfulness, people dare not not use sincerity. Like this, four directions people carry children come, where use farming!"
Fan Chi asked benevolence, Master said: "Love people."
translations.idiomatic: Fanchi asked about benevolence. The Master said: 'Love people.'

translations.literal: Asked wisdom, said: "Know people."
translations.idiomatic: He asked about wisdom. Confucius said: 'Know people.'

translations.literal: Fan Chi asked benevolence, Master said: "Love people." Asked wisdom, said: "Know people."
You Ruo younger than Confucius by forty-three years.
translations.idiomatic: Youruo was forty-three years younger than Confucius.

sentences.zh: 有若曰：「禮之用，和為貴，先王之道斯為美。

translations.literal: You Ruo said: "Ritual use, harmony precious, former kings way this beautiful.
translations.idiomatic: Youruo said: 'In the application of ritual, harmony is precious. The way of the former kings was beautiful in this.'

translations.literal: Small great follow it, have not practice;
translations.idiomatic: Small and great follow it, but there are things that cannot be practiced;

sentences.zh: 知和而和，不以禮節之，亦不可行也。」

translations.literal: Know harmony harmony, not with ritual moderate, also cannot practice."
translations.idiomatic: to know harmony and achieve harmony, but not to moderate it with ritual, cannot be practiced either.'

translations.literal: "Faith near righteousness, words can repeat;
translations.idiomatic: 'Faithfulness approaches righteousness, and words can be repeated;

translations.literal: Respect near ritual, far shame humiliation;
translations.idiomatic: respect approaches ritual, and stays far from shame and humiliation;

translations.literal: Because not lose relatives, also can ancestral."
translations.idiomatic: because of this, one does not lose one's relatives, and can also be ancestral.'

translations.literal: You Ruo younger than Confucius by forty-three years. You Ruo said: "Ritual use, harmony precious, former kings way this beautiful. Small great follow it, have not practice; Know harmony harmony, not with ritual moderate, also cannot practice." "Faith near righteousness, words can repeat; Respect near ritual, far shame humiliation; Because not lose relatives, also can ancestral."

sentences.zh: 孔子既沒，弟子思慕，有若狀似孔子，弟子相與共立為師，師之如夫子時也。

translations.literal: Confucius having died, disciples thought longed, You Ruo appearance similar Confucius, disciples together established as teacher, taught like Master time.
translations.idiomatic: After Confucius died, the disciples thought of him longingly. Youruo resembled Confucius in appearance, so the disciples together established him as teacher and treated him as they had the Master.

sentences.zh: 他日，弟子進問曰：「昔夫子當行，使弟子持雨具，已而果雨。

translations.literal: Another day, disciples advanced asked: "Former Master when go, made disciples hold rain implements, afterward indeed rained.
translations.idiomatic: Another day, the disciples came forward and asked: 'Formerly when the Master was about to travel, he had disciples carry rain gear, and afterward it indeed rained.

sentences.zh: 弟子問曰：『夫子何以知之？』

translations.literal: Disciples asked: "Master how know?"
translations.idiomatic: The disciples asked: 'How did the Master know this?'

translations.literal: Master said: "Poetry not say?
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Does the Poetry not say?'

translations.literal: Moon leaves Bi, causes pouring rain.
translations.idiomatic: 'When the moon leaves Bi, it brings pouring rain.'

translations.literal: Yesterday evening moon not lodge Bi?"
translations.idiomatic: Did the moon not lodge in Bi last evening?'

translations.literal: Another day, moon lodged Bi, finally not rain.
translations.idiomatic: Another day, when the moon lodged in Bi, in the end it did not rain.

sentences.zh: 商瞿年長無子，其母為取室。

translations.literal: Shang Qu year old no son, his mother for take wife.
translations.idiomatic: Shang Qu was old and had no son, so his mother took a wife for him.

translations.literal: Confucius made go Qi, Qu mother requested.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius sent him to Qi. Qu's mother requested him to stay.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：『無憂，瞿年四十後當有五丈夫子。』

translations.literal: Confucius said: "No worry, Qu year forty after should have five men sons."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Do not worry. After Qu reaches forty, he should have five sons.'

translations.literal: Already then indeed.
translations.idiomatic: And indeed it happened.

translations.literal: Asked Master how know this?"
translations.idiomatic: They asked: 'How did the Master know this?'

translations.literal: You Ruo silent no response.
translations.idiomatic: Youruo was silent and had no response.

sentences.zh: 弟子起曰：「有子避之，此非子之座也！」

translations.literal: Disciples rose said: "You Ruo avoid it, this not your seat!"
translations.idiomatic: The disciples rose and said: 'Master You, avoid this. This is not your seat!'

translations.literal: Confucius having died, disciples thought longed, You Ruo appearance similar Confucius, disciples together established as teacher, taught like Master time. Another day, disciples advanced asked: "Former Master when go, made disciples hold rain implements, afterward indeed rained. Disciples asked: "Master how know?" Master said: "Poetry not say? Moon leaves Bi, causes pouring rain. Yesterday evening moon not lodge Bi?" Another day, moon lodged Bi, finally not rain. Shang Qu year old no son, his mother for take wife. Confucius made go Qi, Qu mother requested. Confucius said: "No worry, Qu year forty after should have five men sons." Already then indeed. Asked Master how know this?" You Ruo silent no response. Disciples rose said: "You Ruo avoid it, this not your seat!"
Gong Xi Chi styled Zi Hua.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Xi Chi, whose courtesy name was Zihua.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by forty-two years.
translations.idiomatic: He was forty-two years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Gong Xi Chi styled Zi Hua. Younger than Confucius by forty-two years.

sentences.zh: 子華使於齊，冉有為其母請粟。

translations.literal: Zi Hua envoy to Qi, Ran You for his mother requested grain.
translations.idiomatic: Zihua was sent as envoy to Qi. Ran You requested grain for his mother.

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Give fu."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Give him a fu.'

translations.literal: Requested increase, said: "Give yu."
translations.idiomatic: He requested more. Confucius said: 'Give him a yu.'

translations.literal: Ran Zi gave grain five bing.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Zi gave him five bing of grain.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「赤之適齊也，乘肥馬，衣輕裘。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Chi go Qi, ride fat horses, wear light furs.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'When Chi went to Qi, he rode fat horses and wore light furs.

translations.literal: I heard gentlemen help urgent not continue rich."
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that gentlemen help the urgent but do not continue the rich.'

translations.literal: Zi Hua envoy to Qi, Ran You for his mother requested grain. Confucius said: "Give fu." Requested increase, said: "Give yu." Ran Zi gave grain five bing. Confucius said: "Chi go Qi, ride fat horses, wear light furs. I heard gentlemen help urgent not continue rich."
Wu Ma Shi styled Zi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ma Shi, whose courtesy name was Ziqi.

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty years younger than Confucius.

translations.literal: Wu Ma Shi styled Zi Qi. Younger than Confucius by thirty years.

sentences.zh: 陳司敗問孔子曰：「魯昭公知禮乎？」

translations.literal: Chen Si Bai asked Confucius: "Lu Zhao Gong know ritual?"
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sibai asked Confucius: 'Does Duke Zhao of Lu know ritual?'

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Know ritual."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'He knows ritual.'

sentences.zh: 退而揖巫馬旗曰：「吾聞君子不黨，君子亦黨乎？

translations.literal: Retreated bowed Wu Ma Qi: "I heard gentlemen not partisan, gentlemen also partisan?
translations.idiomatic: He retreated and bowed to Wu Ma Qi, saying: 'I have heard that gentlemen are not partisan. Are gentlemen also partisan?

sentences.zh: 魯君娶吳女為夫人，命之為孟子。

translations.literal: Lu jun take Wu woman as consort, named Meng Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Lu took a woman from Wu as his consort and named her Mengzi.

sentences.zh: 孟子姓姬，諱稱同姓，故謂之孟子。

translations.literal: Meng Zi surname Ji, taboo same surname, therefore call Meng Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Mengzi had the surname Ji. Because of the taboo against speaking of the same surname, she was therefore called Mengzi.

translations.literal: Lu jun know ritual, who not know ritual!"
translations.idiomatic: If the Lord of Lu knows ritual, who does not know ritual!'

sentences.zh: 施以告孔子，孔子曰：「丘也幸，茍有過，人必知之。

translations.literal: Shi told Confucius, Confucius said: "Qiu fortunate, if have error, people must know.
translations.idiomatic: Shi told Confucius this. Confucius said: 'Qiu is fortunate. If he has errors, people will certainly know them.'

sentences.zh: 臣不可言君親之惡，為諱者，禮也。」

translations.literal: Minister cannot speak jun relatives evil, for taboo, ritual."
translations.idiomatic: A minister cannot speak of the lord's or relatives' evils. Such taboos are ritual.'

translations.literal: Chen Si Bai asked Confucius: "Lu Zhao Gong know ritual?" Confucius said: "Know ritual." Retreated bowed Wu Ma Qi: "I heard gentlemen not partisan, gentlemen also partisan? Lu jun take Wu woman as consort, named Meng Zi. Meng Zi surname Ji, taboo same surname, therefore call Meng Zi. Lu jun know ritual, who not know ritual!" Shi told Confucius, Confucius said: "Qiu fortunate, if have error, people must know. Minister cannot speak jun relatives evil, for taboo, ritual."

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：學者多稱七十子之徒，譽者或過其實，毀者或損其真，鈞之未睹厥容貌，則論言弟子籍，出孔氏古文近是。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Scholars many praise seventy disciples followers, praisers sometimes exceed reality, detractors sometimes diminish truth, balanced not seen their appearance, then discuss disciples register, from Kong clan ancient texts near correct.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Scholars frequently praise the followers of the seventy disciples. Those who praise sometimes exceed reality, those who criticize sometimes diminish the truth. Since I have not seen their appearance in a balanced way, I discuss the disciples' register, and taking it from the Kong clan's ancient texts is nearly correct.

sentences.zh: 余以弟子名姓文字悉取論語弟子問并次為篇，疑者闕焉。

translations.literal: I with disciples names surnames characters all take from Analects disciples questions and sequence as chapter, doubtful leave blank.
translations.idiomatic: I have taken all the disciples' names, surnames, and characters from the Analects' disciples' questions and sequenced them as this chapter. Where there is doubt, I have left it blank.

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Scholars many praise seventy disciples followers, praisers sometimes exceed reality, detractors sometimes diminish truth, balanced not seen their appearance, then discuss disciples register, from Kong clan ancient texts near correct. I with disciples names surnames characters all take from Analects disciples questions and sequence as chapter, doubtful leave blank.
